<!-- Meta Title -->
<b:if cond='data:view.isMultipleItems'> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageTitle' property='og:title'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageTitle' property='og:image:alt'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageTitle' name='twitter:title'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageTitle' name='twitter:image:alt'/> <b:else/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageName' property='og:title'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageName' property='og:image:alt'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageName' name='twitter:title'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.pageName' name='twitter:image:alt'/> </b:if> <meta expr:content='data:blog.title' property='og:site_name'/>

<!-- Link Canonical --> <link expr:href='data:blog.url' rel='canonical'/> <link expr:href='data:blog.url' hreflang='x-default' rel='alternate'/> <meta expr:content='data:blog.canonicalUrl' property='og:url'/>

Options"> <Variable name="darkmode" description="Native Dark Mode" type="length" default="0px" min="0px" max="1px" value="0px"/> <Variable name="userdarkmode" description="User Dark Mode" value="1px"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Widths"> <Variable name="boxed" description="Boxed Mode" type="length" default="0px" min="0px" max="1px" value="0px"/> <Variable name="row.width" description="Container Width" type="length" default="1058px" min="970px" max="1160px" value="1120px"/> <Variable name="sidebar.width" description="Sidebar Width" type="length" default="300px" min="250px" max="350px" value="320px"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Fonts"> <Variable name="main.font" description="Site Font" type="font" family="Raleway" default="normal 400 14px $(family)" value="normal 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="menu.font" description="Menu Font" type="font" family="Raleway" default="normal 400 14px $(family)" value="normal 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="title.font" description="Title Font" type="font" family="Raleway" default="normal 400 14px $(family)" value="normal 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="text.font" description="Text Font" type="font" family="Raleway" default="normal 400 14px $(family)" value="normal 400 14px $(family)"/> </Group> <Group description="Background"> <Variable name="background.color" description="Body Background" type="color" default="#F1F3F4" value="#F1F3F4"/> <Variable name="body.background" description="Background" type="background" color="$(background.color)" default="$(color) none repeat fixed top left" value="$(color) none repeat fixed top left"/> <Variable name="outer.bg" description="Outer Background" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="outer.mobile.bg" description="Outer Mobile Background" type="color" default="#F1F3F4" value="#F1F3F4"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Colors"> <Variable name="main.color" description="Theme Color" type="color" Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> <Variable name="meta.color" description="Meta Color" type="color" default="#636466" value="#636466"/> <Variable name="text.color" description="Text Color" type="color" default="#3C4043" value="#3C4043"/> </Group> <Group description="Site Header" selector="#header-wrapper"> <Variable name="header.bg" description="Header Background" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="header.color" description="Header Color" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="header.hover.color" description="Header Hover Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> </Group> <Group description="Sub Menu"> <Variable name="submenu.bg" description="Sub Menu Background" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="submenu.color" description="Sub Menu Color" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="submenu.hover.color" description="Sub Menu Hover Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> </Group> <Group description="Mega Menu"> <Variable name="megamenu.bg" description="Mega Menu Background" type="color" default="$(submenu.bg)" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="megamenu.color" description="Mega Menu Color" type="color" default="$(submenu.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="megamenu.hover.color" description="MegaMenu Hover Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> </Group> <Group description="Mobile Menu"> <Variable name="mmenu.bg" description="Mobile Menu Background" type="color" default="$(outer.bg)" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="mmenu.color" description="Mobile Menu Color" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="mmenu.hover.color" description="Mobile Menu Hover Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> </Group> <Group description="Header ADS" selector="#header-ads-wrap"> <Variable name="headerad.onpost" description="Show on Post Page" type="length" default="1px" min="0px" max="1px" value="1px"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Widgets" select="#sidebar"> <Variable name="widget.bg" description="Widget Background" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="wtitle.color" description="Widget Title Color" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> </Group> <Group description="Post Styles" select="#main"> <Variable name="post.title.color" description="Post Title Color" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="post.title.hover.color" description="Post Title Hover Color" type="color" default="$(title.hover.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> <Variable name="post.text.color" description="Post Page Text Color" type="color" default="$(text.color)" value="#3C4043"/> <Variable name="itempost.title.size" description="Post Page Title Font Size" type="length" default="37px" min="20px" max="50px" value="37px"/> <Variable name="itempost.content.size" description="Post Page Text Font Size" type="length" default="14px" min="12px" max="20px" value="14px"/> </Group> <Group description="Post Page Options" select="#main"> <Variable name="breadcrumb" description="Post Breadcrumbs" type="length" default="1px" min="0px" max="1px" value="1px"/> <Variable name="cmm.count" description="Comments Count" type="length" default="1px" min="0px" max="1px" value="1px"/> <Variable name="postnav" description="Post Navigation" type="length" default="1px" min="0px" max="1px" value="1px"/> </Group> <Group description="Footer ADS" selector="#footer-ads-wrap"> <Variable name="footerad.onpost" description="Show on Post Page" type="length" default="1px" min="0px" max="1px" value="1px"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Footer" selector="#footer-wrapper"> <Variable name="footer.bg" description="Footer Background" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="footer.color" description="Footer Color" type="color" default="$(text.color)" value="#3C4043"/> <Variable name="footer.hover.color" description="Footer Hover Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> </Group> <Group description="FooterBar" selector=".footerbar"> <Variable name="footerbar.bg" description="FooterBar Background" type="color" default="$(footer.bg)" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="footerbar.color" description="FooterBar Color" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="footerbar.hover.color" description="FooterBar Hover Color" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> </Group> <Group description="Cookie Consent" selector="#gnews-pro-cookie-ify"> <Variable name="cookie.bg" description="Cookie Background" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="cookie.color" description="Cookie Text Color" type="color" default="$(text.color)" value="#3C4043"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Buttons"> <Variable name="button.bg" description="Button Background" type="color" default="$(main.color)" value="#1A73E8"/> <Variable name="button.color" description="Button Color" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> <Variable name="button.hover.bg" description="Button Hover Background" type="color" default="#1767D0" value="#1767D0"/> <Variable name="button.hover.color" description="Button Hover Color" type="color" default="#FFFFFF" value="#FFFFFF"/> </Group> <Group description="Theme Fonts (Reset)"> <!-- Site Font --> <Variable name="mainfont.italic" description="Main Font Italic" type="font" default="italic 400 14px $(main.font.family)" value="italic 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="mainfont.medium" description="Main Font Medium" type="font" default="normal 500 14px $(main.font.family)" value="normal 500 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="mainfont.mediumitalic" description="Main Font Medium Italic" type="font" default="italic 500 14px $(main.font.family)" value="italic 500 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="mainfont.bold" description="Main Font Bold" type="font" default="normal 700 14px $(main.font.family)" value="normal 700 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="mainfont.bolditalic" description="Main Font Bold Italic" type="font" default="italic 700 14px $(main.font.family)" value="italic 700 14px $(family)"/> <!-- Menu Font --> <Variable name="menufont.italic" description="Menu Font Italic" type="font" default="italic 400 14px $(menu.font.family)" value="italic 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="menufont.sb" description="Menu Font SemiBold" type="font" default="normal 600 14px $(menu.font.family)" value="normal 600 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="menufont.sbitalic" description="Menu Font SemiBold Italic" type="font" default="italic 600 14px $(menu.font.family)" value="italic 600 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="menufont.bold" description="Menu Font Bold" type="font" default="normal 700 14px $(menu.font.family)" value="normal 700 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="menufont.bolditalic" description="Menu Font Bold Italic" type="font" default="italic 700 14px $(menu.font.family)" value="italic 700 14px $(family)"/> <!-- Title Font --> <Variable name="titlefont.italic" description="Title Font Italic" type="font" default="italic 400 14px $(title.font.family)" value="italic 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="titlefont.sb" description="Title Font SemiBold" type="font" default="normal 600 14px $(title.font.family)" value="normal 600 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="titlefont.sbitalic" description="Title Font SemiBold Italic" type="font" default="italic 600 14px $(title.font.family)" value="italic 600 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="titlefont.bold" description="Title Font Bold" type="font" default="normal 700 14px $(title.font.family)" value="normal 700 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="titlefont.bolditalic" description="Title Font Bold Italic" type="font" default="italic 700 14px $(title.font.family)" value="italic 700 14px $(family)"/> <!-- Text Font --> <Variable name="textfont.italic" description="Text Font Italic" type="font" default="italic 400 14px $(text.font.family)" value="italic 400 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="textfont.medium" description="Text Font Medium" type="font" default="normal 500 14px $(text.font.family)" value="normal 500 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="textfont.mediumitalic" description="Text Font Medium Italic" type="font" default="italic 500 14px $(text.font.family)" value="italic 500 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="textfont.bold" description="Text Font Bold" type="font" default="normal 700 14px $(text.font.family)" value="normal 700 14px $(family)"/> <Variable name="textfont.bolditalic" description="Text Font Bold Italic" type="font" default="italic 700 14px $(text.font.family)" value="italic 700 14px $(family)"/> </Group> <!-- Hidden Variables --> <Variable name="body.background.color" description="Comments Background" hideEditor="true" type="color" default="transparent" value="transparent"/> <Variable name="body.title.color" description="Comments Color" hideEditor="true" type="color" default="$(title.color)" value="#202124"/> <Variable name="body.text.color" description="Comments Text Color" hideEditor="true" type="color" default="$(text.color)" value="#3C4043"/> <Variable description="Comments Font 2" hideEditor="true" type="font" default="normal 700 14px raleway, Arial, sans-serif !important" value="normal 700 14px raleway, Arial, sans-serif !important"/> */

/*-- CSS Variables --*/ :root{ --body-font:'$(main.font.family)', Arial, sans-serif; --menu-font:'$(menu.font.family)', Arial, sans-serif; --title-font:'$(title.font.family)', Arial, sans-serif; --text-font:'$(text.font.family)', Arial, sans-serif; --body-bg-color:$(background.color); --body-bg:$(body.background); --outer-bg:$(outer.bg); --outer-mobile-bg:$(outer.mobile.bg); --main-color:$(main.color); --title-color:$(title.color); --title-hover-color:$(title.hover.color); --meta-color:$(meta.color); --text-color:$(text.color); --header-bg:$(header.bg); --header-color:$(header.color); --header-hover-color:$(header.hover.color); --submenu-bg:$(submenu.bg); --submenu-color:$(submenu.color); --submenu-hover-color:$(submenu.hover.color); --megamenu-bg:$(megamenu.bg); --megamenu-color:$(megamenu.color); --megamenu-hover-color:$(megamenu.hover.color); --mobilemenu-bg:$(mmenu.bg); --mobilemenu-color:$(mmenu.color); --mobilemenu-hover-color:$(mmenu.hover.color); --widget-bg:$(widget.bg); --widget-title-color:$(wtitle.color); --post-card-bg:$(widget.bg); --post-title-color:$(post.title.color); --post-title-hover-color: #893cf7; --post-text-color:$(post.text.color); --footer-bg:$(footer.bg); --footer-color:$(footer.color); --footer-hover-color:$(footer.hover.color); --footerbar-bg:$(footerbar.bg); --footerbar-color:$(footerbar.color); --footerbar-hover-color:$(footerbar.hover.color); --cookie-bg:$(cookie.bg); --cookie-color:$(cookie.color); --button-bg: #893cf7; --button-lite-bg:$(button.bg)10; --button-color:$(button.color); --button-hover-bg:$(button.hover.bg); --button-hover-color:$(button.hover.color); --rgba-gray:rgba(155,170,175,0.12); --border-color:rgba(155,155,155,0.15); --radius:8px; --widget-shadow:0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.025); --avatar-shadow:0px 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.05); } html.is-dark{ --body-bg-color:#2b2b2b; --body-bg:#F1F3F4 none repeat fixed top left; --outer-bg:#1a1a1a; --outer-mobile-bg:#1a1a1a; --title-color:#f6f7f8; --title-hover-color:ACCD55; --meta-color:#aaaaaa; --text-color:#b4b6ba; --header-bg:#202020; --header-color:#f6f7f8; --header-hover-color:#1A73E8; --submenu-bg:#252525; --submenu-color:#f6f7f8; --submenu-hover-color:#1A73E8; --megamenu-bg:#252525; --megamenu-color:#f6f7f8; --megamenu-hover-color:#1A73E8; --mobilemenu-bg:#1b1b1b; --mobilemenu-color:#f6f7f8; --mobilemenu-hover-color:#1A73E8; --widget-bg:#202020; --widget-title-color:#f6f7f8; --post-card-bg:#202020; --post-title-color:#f6f7f8; --post-title-hover-color:#893cf7; --post-text-color:b4b6ba; --footer-bg:#202020; --footer-color:#b4b6ba; --footer-hover-color:#1A73E8; --footerbar-bg:#202020; --footerbar-color:#f6f7f8; --footerbar-hover-color:#1A73E8; --cookie-bg:#202020; --cookie-color:#b4b6ba; --button-bg:#893cf7; --button-color:#fff; --button-hover-bg:#893cf7; --button-hover-color:#FFFFFF; --rgba-gray:rgba(155,155,155,0.04); --border-color:rgba(155,155,155,0.03); } html.rtl{ --body-font:'Tajawal',Arial,sans-serif; --menu-font:'Tajawal',Arial,sans-serif; --title-font:'Tajawal',Arial,sans-serif; --text-font:'Tajawal',Arial,sans-serif; } /*-- Reset CSS --*/ a,abbr,acronym,address,applet,b,big,blockquote,body,caption,center,cite,code,dd,del,dfn,div,dl,dt,em,fieldset,font,form,h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6,html,i,iframe,img,ins,kbd,label,legend,li,object,p,pre,q,s,samp,small,span,strike,strong,sub,sup,table,tbody,td,tfoot,th,thead,tr,tt,u,ul,var{padding:0;margin:0;border:0;outline:none;vertical-align:baseline;background:0 0;text-decoration:none}dl,ul{list-style-position:inside;list-style:none}ul li{list-style:none}caption{text-align:center}img{border:none;position:relative}a,a:visited{text-decoration:none}.clearfix{clear:both}.section,.widget,.widget ul{margin:0;padding:0}a{color:var(--main-color)}a img{border:0}abbr{text-decoration:none}.CSS_LIGHTBOX{z-index:999999!important}.CSS_LIGHTBOX_ATTRIBUTION_INDEX_CONTAINER .CSS_HCONT_CHILDREN_HOLDER > .CSS_LAYOUT_COMPONENT.CSS_HCONT_CHILD:first-child > .CSS_LAYOUT_COMPONENT{opacity:0}.separator a{text-decoration:none!important;clear:none!important;float:none!important;margin-left:0!important;margin-right:0!important}#Navbar1,#navbar-iframe,.widget-item-control,a.quickedit,.home-link,.feed-links{display:none!important}.center{display:table;margin:0 auto;position:relative}.widget > h2,.widget > h3{display:none}.widget iframe,.widget img{max-width:100%}button,input,select,textarea{font-family:var(--body-font);-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;appearance:none;outline:none;border-radius:0}input[type="search"]::-webkit-search-cancel-button{-webkit-appearance:none} /*-- Style CSS --*/ *{box-sizing:border-box} html{position:relative;word-break:break-word;word-wrap:break-word;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-webkit-text-size-adjust:100%} body{position:relative;background:var(--body-bg);background-color:var(--body-bg-color);font-family:var(--body-font);font-size:14px;color:var(--text-color);font-weight:400;font-style:normal;line-height:1.4em} .rtl{direction:rtl} h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,h6{font-family:var(--title-font);font-weight:700} a,input,button{ transition: .25ms cubic-bezier(0.18, 0.86, 0.15, 0.88);} #outer-wrapper{position:relative;overflow:hidden;width:100%;max-width:100%;background-color:var(--outer-bg);margin:0 auto;padding:0} .is-boxed #outer-wrapper{width:$(row.width + 60px);max-width:100%;box-shadow:0 0 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)} .is-dark .is-boxed #outer-wrapper{box-shadow:0 0 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)} .container{position:relative} .row-x1{width:$(row.width);max-width:100%} .row-x2{width:100%} .flex-center{display:flex;justify-content:center} #content-wrapper{position:relative;float:left;width:100%;overflow:hidden;padding:30px 0;margin:0} #content-wrapper > .container{display:flex;justify-content:space-between} .is-left #content-wrapper > .container,.rtl .is-right #content-wrapper > .container{flex-direction:row-reverse} .rtl .is-left #content-wrapper > .container{flex-direction:row} .theiaStickySidebar:before,.theiaStickySidebar:after{content:'';display:table;clear:both} #main-wrapper{position:relative;width:calc(100% - $(sidebar.width + 30px))} .no-sidebar #main-wrapper{width:100%} #sidebar-wrapper{position:relative;width:$(sidebar.width)} .no-sidebar #sidebar-wrapper{display:none} .btn{justify-content: center; border: 0; border-radius: var(--radius); width: 100%; max-width:100% }

<style> .matchflex{display:flex;flex-direction:column;margin:0px 12px 0} .match-event{border:1px solid #ddd;overflow:hidden;text-align:center;background:#D4D5DE;margin-bottom:10px;position:relative;border-radius:5px;} .match-event.h{display:none} .match-name,.match-event.ch-end #match-hour,.match-event.ch-live #match-hour,.match-event.ch-soon #result-now,.match-event.notstart #result-now,.match-event.h,.match-event.ch-end #match-live,.match-event.d #match-live{display:none!important} .match-event:last-child{margin-bottom:12px} .matchflex{display:flex;flex-direction:column;margin:5px 5px 0} .match-event.ch-live{order:} .match-event.ch-soon{order:} .match-event.ch-end{order:5} .match-event a{color:#222} .match-event h4{margin:10px 0;color:#444;font-size:18px}
.first-team,.left-team,.match-time{width:33.33333333%;float:right;color:#444} .team-logo { float: right; width: 100%; } .left-team .team-logo { float: left; } .team-logo img { margin: 4px auto; display: flex; }
.team-name { margin: 0px auto; display: table; } .left-team .team-logo{float:left} .team-name{display:table;color:#000; font-weight: bold} .match-timing{margin:35px 0;color:#000; font-weight: bold;} .league-logo img{margin:5px auto} #result-now{font-size:31px;letter-spacing:5px;margin-right:-5px;color:#444} #result-noww{font-size:31px;margin-right:-5px;direction:ltr}
.match-timing .match-date, .match-timing .live:before { color: #fff; background: #263545; border-radius: 5px; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1; display: table; margin: auto; padding: 8px; }
.match-timing .live { background: #931800; animation: blinker 1s linear infinite; }
@keyframes blinker { 50% { opacity: 0; } }
.match-timing .end{background:#474747} .match-timing .soon{background:#0f6f37} .match-info ul{list-style:none} #overlay-match{position:absolute;top:0;bottom:0;left:0;right:0;height:100%;width:100%;opacity:0;cursor:pointer;background:rgb(0 0 0 / 60%);z-index:8} .match-event:hover #overlay-match{opacity:1}#watch-match{position:absolute;bottom:0;right:0;height:45px;margin:auto;left:0;top:0;width:45px;background:no-repeat center url("data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf8,%3Csvg aria-hidden='true' role='img' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 512 512' %3E%3Cpath fill='%23fff' d='M256,0C114.617,0,0,114.615,0,256s114.617,256,256,256s256-114.615,256-256S397.383,0,256,0z M344.48,269.57l-128,80 c-2.59,1.617-5.535,2.43-8.48,2.43c-2.668,0-5.34-0.664-7.758-2.008C195.156,347.172,192,341.82,192,336V176 c0-5.82,3.156-11.172,8.242-13.992c5.086-2.836,11.305-2.664,16.238,0.422l128,80c4.676,2.93,7.52,8.055,7.52,13.57 S349.156,266.641,344.48,269.57z' class=''%3E%3C/path%3E%3C/svg%3E")}
</style>
<style> .s-text strong,.social-counter{font-weight:900}.techornate-socials a{display:block;color:#fff;padding:12px 9px;border-radius:6px;position:relative;margin-bottom:5px;text-decoration:none}.techornate-socials a span,.techornate-socials a:before{z-index:2;position:relative}.social-counter{position:absolute;font-family:opensans;font-size:17px;line-height:1;padding-top:4px}.s-text{float:right}.techornate-socials a:after{content:" ";height:100%;width:0;top:0;left:0;position:absolute;background:#0a0647;z-index:1}.fa-subscribe:before,.fa-twitter:before{display:inline-block;width:16px;font-family:opensans;margin-right:10px;padding-right:10px;font-size:18px;border-right:1px solid rgba(255,255,255,.3)}.fa-play{background:#d2002c}.fa-play:after{content:"\f167"} .fa-whatsapp{background:#09b320}
/* Refresh Button Style */ input.MyButton { width: 200px; padding: 7px; cursor: pointer; font-weight: bold; font-size: 100%; background: #0a0647; color: #fff; border: 1px solid #0a0647; border-radius: 10px; } input.MyButton:hover { color: #ff0000; background: #000; border: 1px solid #fff; }

<script> function updateCountdown(eventStartDateTime, eventEndDateTime, countdownClock) { var now = luxon.DateTime.utc(); var startDistance = eventStartDateTime.diff(now).valueOf(); var endDistance = eventEndDateTime.diff(now).valueOf();
if (startDistance > 0) { var countdownInterval = setInterval(function () { startDistance -= 1000; // Subtract 1 second every second if (startDistance <= 0) { clearInterval(countdownInterval); // Clear the interval when countdown reaches 0 countdownClock.innerHTML = "Live Now"; } else { var startDuration = getTimeRemaining(startDistance); countdownClock.innerHTML = formatDuration(startDuration); } }, 1000); } else if (endDistance > 0) { countdownClock.innerHTML = "Live Now"; } }
function getTimeRemaining(distance) { var days = Math.floor(distance / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)); var hours = Math.floor((distance % (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) / (1000 * 60 * 60)); var minutes = Math.floor((distance % (1000 * 60 * 60)) / (1000 * 60)); var seconds = Math.floor((distance % (1000 * 60)) / 1000);
return { days: days, hours: hours, minutes: minutes, seconds: seconds, }; }
function formatDuration(duration) { return duration.hours + "h " + duration.minutes + "m " + duration.seconds + "s"; }
function createCountdown(countdownElement) { var startDateTime = luxon.DateTime.fromISO(countdownElement.getAttribute("data-start")); var endDateTime = luxon.DateTime.fromISO(countdownElement.getAttribute("data-gameends"));
updateCountdown(startDateTime, endDateTime, countdownElement); }
// Call createCountdown for each countdown clock with the class "match-date" var countdownElements = document.querySelectorAll(".match-date"); countdownElements.forEach(function (element) { createCountdown(element); });
</script> <script> // Your JavaScript code here function convertToUserTimezone(kathmanduTime) { var userTimezone = Intl.DateTimeFormat().resolvedOptions().timeZone; var kathmanduOffset = 5.75 * 60; // Kathmandu timezone offset in minutes (+5 hours and 45 minutes) var userOffset = new Date().getTimezoneOffset(); // User's timezone offset in minutes (negative for behind UTC) var offsetDifference = (userOffset + kathmanduOffset) * 60 * 1000; // Convert to milliseconds
var userTime = new Date(kathmanduTime.getTime() - offsetDifference);
var options = { month: 'short', // Display month in abbreviated format (e.g., Jan, Feb) day: 'numeric', hour: 'numeric', minute: 'numeric' };
return userTime.toLocaleString(undefined, options); }
// Get all elements with class "eventDateInKathmandu" and update their text content var eventDatesInKathmandu = document.querySelectorAll(".eventDateInKathmandu");
for (var i = 0; i < eventDatesInKathmandu.length; i++) { var matchDateElement = eventDatesInKathmandu[i].previousElementSibling; var eventDateTime = matchDateElement.getAttribute("data-start");
if (eventDateTime) { var userTimezone = convertToUserTimezone(new Date(eventDateTime)); eventDatesInKathmandu[i].textContent = userTimezone; } } </script>

entry.title: West Indies vs England 42nd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The second game in Group 2 of the Super Eights has England facing off against the West Indies at the Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium in Gros Islet, St. Lucia. In the first stage of the tournament, England finished second in Group B, while West Indies topped Group C.

England managed to keep their T20 World Cup hopes alive by winning their last two group games against Oman and Namibia. Before that, they were in a tough spot with a no-result against Scotland and a loss to Australia. This match will be a bigger challenge compared to their recent games.

On the other hand, West Indies cruised through their matches against PNG and Uganda, faced a tough battle with New Zealand, but then dominated Afghanistan in Match 40. With strong performances both with the bat and ball, they are confident heading into this game against the reigning champions.

West Indies hit 218/5 in the last game at this venue so we can expect another good batting wicket. There will be some turn but overall it will be a good paced pitch and a par score is likely to be over 190.


England Predicted Playing 11
Phil Salt, Jos Buttler (c) (wk), Will Jacks, Jonny Bairstow, Moeen Ali, Harry Brook, Sam Curran, Chris Jordan, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid, Mark Wood

West Indies Predicted Playing 11
Brandon King, Johnson Charles, Nicholas Pooran (wk), Shai Hope, Rovman Powell (c), Andre Russell, Sherfane Rutherford, Akeal Hosein, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie, Obed McCoy

link.title: West Indies vs England 42nd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Scotland vs Switzerland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
After suffering their worst-ever opening defeat at the men's European Championships, Scotland aims to regain their pride on Wednesday when they face Switzerland in Euro 2024 Group A in Cologne.

Steve Clarke's team was embarrassed 5-1 by hosts Germany, while Switzerland managed to avoid a similar fate by defeating Hungary 3-1.

Due to a straight red card in the loss to Germany, Scotland will be without the suspended Porteous for Wednesday's game and their final group match against Hungary. Either Grant Hanley or Scott McKenna will fill in at the back.

Porteous's offense initially carried a one-game ban, but UEFA increased his punishment, likely ending his tournament. McKenna's header was deflected into the German net by Rudiger on Friday, but Hanley is expected to get the nod from Clarke, who may also make a few changes further up the field.

Billy Gilmour, surprisingly left out against Germany, is a strong candidate for the starting lineup, while Che Adams, who struggled to make an impact against the Germans, may be replaced by Lawrence Shankland.

In good news for Switzerland, midfielder Denis Zakaria, recovering from a thigh injury, is back in full training and could be part of the squad, though a start seems unlikely.

Steven Zuber has also rejoined the team after a brief discomfort, while Silvan Widmer and Remo Freuler risk suspension for the Germany match if they are cautioned here. Coach Yakin was booked for dissent over the weekend as well.


Despite this, the Swiss coach is likely to stick with his successful lineup, keeping Embolo in reserve as he builds fitness and maintaining faith in Duah, who impressed in his second appearance for Switzerland against Hungary at age 27.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Scotland vs Switzerland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Germany vs Hungary | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
An almost perfect evening for Germany against Scotland saw none of Nagelsmann's players pick up any knocks, and both fans and neutrals were pleased to see Gundogan emerge unharmed from Porteous's sickening challenge, having caught the Barcelona man on the ankle with the full force of his studs.

Indeed, Nagelsmann confirmed at his pre-game press conference that he has everyone fit and available for matchday two, although he has stressed that in-game alterations could once again be pivotal to his side's hopes of an emphatic success.

Gundogan is expected to form a part of an unchanged XI for the tournament hosts, working in tandem with man-of-the-match Musiala and Bayer Leverkusen hotshot Wirtz, now the youngest German man to score a goal at the European Championships.

As Robert Andrich and Jonathan Tah were both booked against Scotland, they run the risk of sitting out the final group game versus Switzerland if they pick up a yellow card on Wednesday, although it may be preferable for them to miss that match if Germany have already qualified.

Meanwhile, Hungary head coach Rossi was unable to call upon either Loic Nego or Callum Styles for the loss to Switzerland due to unspecified fitness concerns, although the latter is on track to be available for this one.

However, the same cannot be said of Nego, and Rossi has also been deprived of 22-year-old defender Botond Balogh, who hurt his ankle in practice and will not be part of the selection either.

Even with Nego absent, Rossi could still opt for a change on the right-hand side in the shape of Bendeguz Bolla - one of two players walking a suspension tightrope alongside Attila Szalai - or Endre Botka, after giving 34-year-old Attila Fiola the nod in the opener.



Now the youngest male captain in Euros history, Liverpool's Dominik Szoboszlai cut a frustrated figure before providing the assist for Varga's header on Saturday, and a 44th cap now awaits the 23-year-old.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Germany vs Hungary | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: USA vs South Africa 41st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The United States and South Africa will square off in the first match of the Super 8 round of the T20 World Cup 2024. This exciting game is set to take place at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in North Sound, Antigua, on June 19, 2024, at 8:15 PM NST.

As co-hosts, the USA team has been outstanding, even knocking out former champions Pakistan to reach the Super 8. This is their debut in the T20 World Cup, and they have delivered an impressive overall performance.


South Africa, on the other hand, has maintained a 4-match winning streak, narrowly beating Nepal by just 1 run in their last match. Despite facing challenges in the group stage, they've consistently had one or two players step up and turn the game in their favor.

The pitch offers a good track for the bowlers, especially pacers. The average innings score is just around 110 and we have seen some quite low scoring games here. Spinners are also able to pick wickets but pacers get more assistance. Batters need to settle well before going for big shots.

The weather report shows a cloudy day in North Sound, Antigua on Wednesday. The temperature will hover around 30-31C and there will be few chances of rain showers.

USA Predicted Playing 11 
Steven Taylor, Monank Patel (c & wk), Andries Gous, Aaron Jones, Nitish Kumar, Corey Anderson, Harmeet Singh, Jasdeep Singh, Nosthush Kenjige, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ali Khan

South Africa Predicted Playing 11 
Quinton de Kock (wk), Reeza Hendricks, Aiden Markram (c), Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Tristan Stubbs, Marco Jansen, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Ottneil Baartman, Tabraiz Shamsi

link.title: USA vs South Africa 41st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Croatia vs Albania | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
With both teams needing a win, Croatia and Albania face off in Hamburg on Wednesday afternoon, determined not to fall further behind in Group B.

After losing their Euro 2024 openers last weekend, both teams are eager to keep their tournament hopes alive. Croatia's coach, Zlatko Dalic, might shake things up after their sluggish start against Spain. 


Manchester City's Josko Gvardiol could return to central defense, possibly replacing Marin Pongracic, while Borna Sosa might come in at left-back. Theres also talk of dropping Marcelo Brozovic to give Luka Sucic or Mario Pasalic a chance in midfield.

Even though Luka Modric only played 65 minutes, he made the most line-breaking passes (13) in Saturday's game, and he'll be crucial again for the Vatreni. The front three is expected to stay the same, despite Bruno Petkovic missing a penalty, especially since veteran winger Ivan Perisic isnt fully fit after a long injury layoff.

Torino forward Nikola Vlasic is out for the rest of the tournament due to a minor muscle tear, as revealed by an MRI scan following an injury in training.

On the Albanian side, Jasir Asani, who had been a doubt due to an ankle problem, has been declared fit by coach Sylvinho. Arber Hoxha, who plays for Dinamo Zagreb, will likely remain a substitute. Up front, either Rey Manaj or Chelsea's Armando Broja will lead the attack, since regular starter Sokol Cikalleshi retired from international play after being left out of the squad.


Nedim Bajrami, who has been involved in at least one goal in each of his last three appearances, will support the central striker. The Sassuolo playmaker was a key figure in qualifying, scoring a team-high three goals in seven starts.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Croatia vs Albania | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Turkey vs Georgia | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Group F at Euro 2024 kicks off on Tuesday evening in Dortmund with a crucial match between Turkey and Georgia. Portugal and the Czech Republic are also in this group, and while Portugal is the clear favorite to top the table, the other three teams are vying for the second spot. 

Turkey has faced some setbacks, losing Enes Unal, Caglar Soyuncu, and Ozan Kabak to injuries. Additionally, Dogan Alemdar, Cenk Ozkacar, Berat Ozdemir, Can Uzun, Abdulkadir Omur, and Oguz Aydin were cut from the preliminary squad.


Kerem Akturkoglu, who has scored five goals in 29 appearances for Turkey, will start in the attack. Juventus' Kenan Yildiz is expected to play in the number 10 role, likely behind Baris Alper Yilmaz. 

Merih Demiral is set to start in central defense, while Hakan Calhanoglu will captain the team from midfield. Real Madrid's Arda Guler is also expected to start, having impressed at the club level last season.

For Georgia, Solomon Kvirkvelia is expected to recover from an injury to start in defense, with Giorgi Gvelesiani on standby. Otar Kiteishvili should be fit to play in midfield after an injury scare against Montenegro. 


Georges Mikautadze, with 10 goals in 25 appearances, will lead the attack alongside Kvaratskhelia. Jaba Kankava was replaced in the squad by Gabriel Sigua, and the 18-year-old could make his second national team appearance in this match.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Turkey vs Georgia | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Portugal vs Czech Republic | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
One of the top contenders for this summer's European Championship, Portugal, will kick off their Euro 2024 journey on Tuesday evening against the Czech Republic at Leipzig Stadium.

Portugal is seen as a strong favorite to win the tournament in Germany, while the Czech Republic aims to advance from a group that also includes Turkey and Georgia. Portugal's head coach, Martinez, has several tough choices to make for his team selection on Tuesday, given the squad's depth.

While some key players will start on the bench, 39-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo is set to lead the attack, hoping to add to his 130 international goals. Ronaldo is on the brink of making history by appearing in his sixth European Championship and aiming to become the oldest player to score in the competition.

Veteran defender Pepe, who will be 41 years and 113 days old when Portugal begins their campaign, is expected to start in defense, making him the oldest player in the tournament's history.

Rafael Leao and Bernardo Silva might join Ronaldo in the attack, with Bruno Fernandes, Vitinha, and Joao Palhinha in midfield. On the Czech side, midfielder Michal Sadilek had to withdraw from the squad due to a bike injury before the tournament started.

West Ham United's Vladimir Coufal and Tomas Soucek are set to start, and Jan Kutcha is expected to play in the attack on Tuesday night.


Patrik Schick, the squad's top scorer with 19 goals, will lead the Czech offense, aiming to add to his five European Championship goals. Adam Hlozek, with two international goals, is another potential attacking option against Portugal.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Portugal vs Czech Republic | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: West Indies vs Afghanistan 40th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The West Indies and Afghanistan, both at the top of the standings, are set to face off in the 40th match of the T20 World Cup 2024. This exciting game will take place at the Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium in Gros Islet, St Lucia, on June 17, 2024, starting at 6:00 AM IST on June 18.

The West Indies, co-hosts and two-time champions, have been in top form this tournament, winning three consecutive matches. A win against Afghanistan would secure their position at the top of the group stage.


Afghanistan has also been impressive, notably defeating a strong New Zealand team by 84 runs. They, too, are on a three-match winning streak and have yet to lose in this T20 World Cup. Theyll be looking to continue their excellent performance and potentially finish at the top of the points table.

The pitch at Daren Sammy Stadium offers a good batting track which has a lot of runs in it. Any team with a quality batting line-up will be able to chase high targets here. Both pacers and spinners will be able to pick wickets but those will come at the cost of high economy. The average innings score will be around 175-180.

West Indies Predicted Playing 11
Brandon King, Johnson Charles, Nicholas Pooran (wk), Roston Chase, Rovman Powell (c), Sherfane Rutherford, Andre Russell, Romario Shepherd, Akeal Hosein, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie

Afghanistan Predicted Playing 11
Rahmanullah Gurbaz (wk), Ibrahim Zadran, Gulbadin Naib, Azmatullah Omarzai, Mohammad Nabi, Najibullah Zadran, Karim Janat, Rashid Khan (c), Noor Ahmad, Naveen-ul-Haq, Fazalhaq Farooqi

link.title: West Indies vs Afghanistan 40th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Euro 2024 - France vs Austria | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
The Merkur Spiel-Arena in Dusseldorf will host the final Euro 2024 match on Monday, featuring in-form Austria against title favorites France in Group D.

Austria has never made it past the round of 16 in the European Championships, while France, with two titles, is looking to redeem itself after a disappointing run three years ago. Austria is missing some key players, including David Alaba and Sasa Kalajdzic due to ACL injuries, and Xaver Schlager, who has a serious knee problem. 

Live Match - Animation Tracker

$ads={2}
Mobile - France vs Austria
Best - France vs Austria
Fast - France vs Austria
Fast - France vs Austria
Fast - France vs Austria
Best - France vs Austria

Link 3 - France vs Austria

Link 5 - France vs Austria
Link 6 - France vs Austria
Link 7 - France vs Austria
Link 8 - France vs Austria

However, veteran striker Marko Arnautovic is fit and ready, though Michael Gregoritsch is expected to start as the main striker in Ralf Rangnick's 4-2-3-1 formation. Stefan Posch has recovered from a knee issue and is set to start in defense, despite Gernot Trauner missing training as a precaution.

For France, Kingsley Coman had an illness earlier in the week but should be fit to play. Kylian Mbappe, despite a knee scare in a friendly against Luxembourg, is also ready to go. Aurelien Tchouameni is still recovering from a foot injury, so Adrien Rabiot is expected to start in midfield. 


Tchouameni is back in training but likely to be rested for the match against Austria. Joining Rabiot in midfield will be N'Golo Kante, who returns after a successful first year at Al-Ittihad and is expected to start over Warren Zaire-Emery and Eduardo Camavinga. In defense, William Saliba is now expected to start, with Ibrahima Konate moving to the bench after Didier Deschamps changed his mind.

This match promises to be a thrilling encounter as Austria and France both aim for a strong start in their Euro 2024 campaigns.

link.title: Euro 2024 - France vs Austria | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Belgium vs Slovakia | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Belgium and Slovakia will kick off their Euro 2024 Group E campaigns on Monday evening with an exciting match at Frankfurt Arena.

Romania and Ukraine are also in this group, making it a highly competitive section. Both Belgium and Slovakia are eager to start strong. Unfortunately, Belgium will be without Jan Vertonghen and Arthur Theate due to injuries, and Thomas Meunier is also doubtful.


Belgium is expected to play in a 3-4-2-1 formation, with their top scorer, Romelu Lukaku, leading the attack. Lukaku has scored 85 goals in 115 appearances for Belgium, and the 31-year-old will be crucial to their success in the tournament.

Manchester City stars Jeremy Doku and Kevin De Bruyne will be key players, while the defensive absences might give Maxim De Cuyper, the Club Brugge defender, a chance to earn his third cap. Axel Witsel will likely be in central defense, alongside Leicester City's Wout Faes. In midfield, Everton's Amadou Onana and Orel Mangala are expected to start, with Youri Tielemans and Arthur Vermeeren available as substitutes.

For Slovakia, Denis Vavro has a minor thigh issue but is expected to start. Juraj Kucka should also be fit, and Robert Bozenik, who has seven international goals, will be in the attack.

The Slovakia squad is led by Paris Saint-Germain defender Milan Skriniar, who will earn his 69th cap. Their top scorer, Ondrej Duda, with 13 goals, is a sure starter, and Napoli midfielder Stanislav Lobotka will play his 56th match for Slovakia.


Both teams are set for an intense clash as they aim to begin their Euro 2024 journey with a win.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Belgium vs Slovakia | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Netherlands vs Poland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Euro 2024's Group D kicks off with Poland facing the Netherlands at Hamburg's Volksparkstadion on Sunday. Poland barely made it to the finals through a nerve-wracking playoff, while the Netherlands cruised through qualification and are aiming for their second European title. 

Poland will miss their star forward Robert Lewandowski, who is their top scorer at the Euros with five of their 11 goals. Juventus striker Arkadiusz Milik is also out with a knee injury, adding to his run of bad luck.

Live Match - Animation Tracker

$ads={2}

Lewandowski just returned to individual training and might be available for next weeks matches. This leaves coach Michal Probierz needing to adjust his attack. Karol Swiderski is back in shape after an ankle injury and might play as a 'false nine,' or the more traditional options of Adam Buksa or Krzysztof Piatek could lead the line.

Several Serie A players are in the mix for Sundays game. Bologna's 19-year-old winger Kacper Urbanski might get a chance, Hellas Verona defender Pawel Dawidowicz is hopeful of recovering from injury, and Wojciech Szczesny from Juventus will be in goal. Inter Milan-bound Piotr Zielinski will command the midfield and wear the captains armband in Lewandowskis absence.

On the Dutch side, Memphis Depay is expected to be the lone striker, though Wout Weghorst is also an option. Ajax forward Brian Brobbey is sidelined with a hamstring strain. With Frenkie de Jong out due to an ankle injury, along with Atalanta BCs Marten De Roon and Teun Koopmeiners, full-back Ian Maatsen has been called up. Nathan Ake or Micky van de Ven will likely start on the left side of defense.


With many midfield absences, PSVs Joey Veerman and Jerdy Schouten might partner up in the middle, pushing Georginio Wijnaldum to the bench. Denzel Dumfries, who had five assists during Euro 2024 qualifyingsecond only to Portugals Bruno Fernandeswill play on the right flank, competing with Bayer Leverkusens Jeremie Frimpong for the spot.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Netherlands vs Poland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: England vs Namibia 34th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
It's the final match of Group B, with England facing off against Namibia in Antigua on Saturday. Defending champions England are coming off a dominant win over Oman and are eager to secure their second victory of the tournament. Namibia, meanwhile, hopes to finish their campaign on a high note by upsetting the highly favored English team.

Namibia (NAM) started the T20 World Cup with a thrilling Super Over win against Oman. However, they were outplayed by Australia in their next match and subsequently lost to Scotland, ending their hopes of reaching the Super 8 stages. Despite this, captain Gerhard Erasmus remains proud and is focused on taking away the positives from their campaign.

England (ENG) had a massive victory against Oman, winning with 101 balls to spare. This win keeps their hopes alive for advancing to the Super 8 stage. They could still make it to the next phase of the tournament as the second-place team if Australia defeats Scotland.

In Thursdays game at this venue we saw pace for the quick bowlers as well as plenty of turn for the spinners. England also showed that you can score quick runs on the pitch at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium and we expect a par score to be approaching 175.


Namibia Predicted Playing 11
Michael van Lingen, Nikolas Davin, Jan Frylinck, Gerhard Erasmus (c), JJ Smit, Zane Green (wk), David Wiese, Ruben Trumpelmann, Bernard Scholtz, Jack Brassell, Ben Shikongo

England Predicted Playing 11
Jos Buttler (wk) (c), Phil Salt, Will Jacks, Jonny Bairstow, Harry Brook, Moeen Ali, Liam Livingstone, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid, Mark Wood, Reece Topley

link.title: England vs Namibia 34th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Italy vs Albania | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Italy will begin defending their European title with a Group B clash against Albania on Saturday evening, marking the start of their Euro 2024 campaign.

The Azzurri aim to win back-to-back Euros, while their neighbors Albania hope to advance from the group stage in only their second major tournament appearance. Italys coach, Luciano Spalletti, had to make adjustments to his preliminary 30-man squad due to injuries.

Francesco Acerbi (groin) and Giorgio Scalvini (ACL) are out, joined by Nicolo Zaniolo, Domenico Berardi, Destiny Udogie, and suspended midfielder Sandro Tonali.

On a brighter note, Davide Frattesi and Nicolo Fagiolidespite Fagioli's limited playtime due to a betting banalong with Nicolo Barella, who led Italy in assists and chances during qualifying, are all expected to recover from minor muscle issues.

Spalletti has been experimenting with different formations and players recently. However, captain Gianluigi Donnarumma is a definite starter in goal. Up front, the choice seems to be between Gianluca Scamacca and Genoa's Mateo Retegui.

For Albania, Atalanta BC defender Berat Djimsiti will captain the team from the center-back position, following his key role in La Dea's Europa League victory last month. Kristjan Asllani, who recently won the Scudetto with Inter Milan, will play as a deep-lying playmaker.


Despite tough times at club level, Armando Broja is set to lead Albanias attack, taking over from the retired Sokol Cikalleshi, who played in all eight qualification matches.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Italy vs Albania | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Spain vs Croatia | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
The much-anticipated opening match of Group B at this summer's European Championship will take place in Berlin on Saturday, featuring a clash between Spain and Croatia.

Spain, three-time winners of the European Championship and semi-finalists in Euro 2020, face a Croatian team that has never advanced past the quarter-finals in this competition. Spain's head coach, De la Fuente, has kept his lineup plans under wraps, creating some uncertainty about the starting XI.

Live Match - Animation Tracker


Mikel Merino and Dani Olmo are possible starters, though they might begin on the bench, with Fabian Ruiz and Nico Williams potentially starting instead.

Aymeric Laporte was expected to start, but a muscular issue kept him out of training on Thursday, so Nacho is likely to step in at central defense.

Lamine Yamal, at just 16 years old, is set to become the youngest player to ever appear in a European Championship, expected to start on the right for Spain. Dani Carvajal, fresh off a La Liga and Champions League double with Real Madrid, will be at right-back, while Alex Grimaldo is anticipated to start at left-back.

Croatia's lineup also has some uncertainties, but their midfield trio of Luka Modric, Mateo Kovacic, and Marcelo Brozovic is certain to start. Lovro Majer, who has scored eight goals in 31 caps, is likely to join the starting lineup, with Andrej Kramaric and Ante Budimir possibly completing the attack.


Ivan Perisic is still recovering from a serious knee injury and will probably start on the bench, while Marin Pongracic is expected to pair with Josip Sutalo in central defense. Josko Gvardiol will face his Manchester City teammate Rodri, and Josip Stanisic from Bayer Leverkusen will take the spot on the opposite side of the defense.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Spain vs Croatia | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Hungary vs Switzerland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Hungary and Switzerland are set to begin their Euro 2024 journeys with a Group A match at RheinEnergieStadion in Cologne on Saturday afternoon.

Joining them in Group A are Scotland and hosts Germany, who will kick off the tournament in Munich on Friday night. Hungarys captain, Dominik Szoboszlai, had a minor hamstring issue during a friendly win over Israel but is fit and ready to play. The Liverpool midfielder will be in an advanced role alongside Roland Sallai, who is about to earn his 50th cap.

Coach Rossi is likely to use a 3-4-2-1 formation, featuring Adam Lang, Willi Orban, and Attila Szalai in central defense, with experienced goalkeeper Peter Gulacsi behind them.

Loic Nego and Bournemouths Milos Kerkez are expected to serve as wing-backs, with Adam Nagy and Andras Schafer in midfield. Barnabas Varga, who netted 29 goals for Ferencvaros last season, is set to lead the attack.

For Switzerland, Steven Zuber suffered a calf injury during a friendly against Austria and only managed individual training on Wednesday, making his participation on Saturday uncertain. However, Monacos Breel Embolo and Denis Zakaria have recovered from their injuries and joined team training, potentially making the matchday squad.


Key players such as captain Granit Xhaka, Manuel Akanji, and Xherdan Shaqiri are expected to start, along with Burnley striker Zeki Amdouni, who has scored seven goals in 15 international appearances.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Hungary vs Switzerland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: India vs Canada 33rd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
All the teams in Group A are looking forward to leaving New York and heading to Florida for the final round. Rohit Sharma and his team have already secured their spot in the Super 8 stage with a win over the USA. Meanwhile, Canada faces elimination if the USA vs. Ireland game gets rained out or if the USA wins.

India has been on a winning streak, securing three consecutive victories, and they aim to make it four. Rohit Sharma knows that winning this next game is crucial since points will carry over to the Super 8 stage. The Indian team had to dig deep to win their three challenging games in New York, especially against Pakistan.

Canada started their campaign with a loss to co-hosts USA, but bounced back with a significant win over Canada, marking their first victory in the T20 World Cup. However, their hopes took a hit with a subsequent loss to Pakistan, making it tough for them to advance to the next stage.

Moving from the tough pitch in New York, we are in Florida now and the average innings score here is around 160-170. There will be help for the batters as the surface has good bounce and the ball comes on to the bat nicely. Fast bowlers will be able pick more wickets here with seam movement assistance.


India Predicted Playing 11
Rohit Sharma (c), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Mohammed Siraj

Canada Predicted Playing 11
Aaron Johnson, Navneet Dhaliwal, Pargat Singh, Nicholas Kirton, Shreyas Movva (wk), Dilpreet Bajwa, Saad Bin Zafar (c), Dillon Heyliger, Kaleem Sana, Junaid Siddiqui, Jeremy Gordon

link.title: India vs Canada 33rd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Nepal vs South Africa 31st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
South Africa, having already secured a spot in the Super 8s of the 2024 ICC T20 World Cup, is aiming for a perfect record as they face off against the struggling Nepal on Saturday, June 15, at the Arnos Vale Stadium in Kingstown, Saint Vincent.

This will be the first-ever international clash between the Proteas and the Rhinos, set to be match number 31 of the T20 World Cup 2024.


Under the leadership of Adrian Markram, South Africa has amassed 6 points from their three consecutive wins. Despite some close calls, they triumphed over Sri Lanka by 6 wickets, the Netherlands by 4 wickets, and Bangladesh by 4 runs, earning them a place in the tournaments main stage.

In contrast, Nepal is still searching for their first victory in this tournament. With their second match against Sri Lanka ending in a washout, the team, led by Rohit Paudel, has only 1 point and sits in the second-to-last position in Group D. To advance to the Super 8, the Rhinos will need to win their remaining matches against South Africa and Bangladesh.


South Africa Squad:
Quinton de Kock (wk), Aiden Markram (c), Reeza Hendricks, Tristan Stubbs, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Ottneil Baartman, Gerald Coetzee, Ryan Rickelton, Bjorn Fortuin, Tabraiz Shamsi

Nepal Squad:
Aasif Sheikh (wk), Rohit Paudel (c), Kushal Bhurtel, Anil Sah, Kushal Malla, Dipendra Singh Airee, Sompal Kami, Gulsan Jha, Karan KC, Sagar Dhakal, Abinash Bohara, Kamal Singh Airee, Lalit Rajbanshi, Sundeep Jora, Pratis GC, Sandeep Lamichhane

link.title: Nepal vs South Africa 31st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Euro 2024 - Germany vs Scotland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Fans are eagerly anticipating the start of Euro 2024 as they gather at the Allianz Arena in Munich this Friday. The hosts, Germany, kick off the tournament against Scotland in Group A.

For Germany, this tournament is a golden opportunity to bounce back from recent disappointments and aim for glory reminiscent of their 1972, 1980, and 1996 championship wins. On the other hand, Scotland has more modest goals. They're looking to make their first knockout-round appearance and will play their 10th match at the Euros under the bright lights of the Allianz Arena.


Scotland has had some success in the group stages before, winning one match in both the 1992 and 1996 editions, but they bowed out early each time. Their return to the Euros in 2021 was tough, failing to secure a single victory and earning just one point from three matches. This was followed by their inability to qualify for the World Cup, continuing a drought that dates back to 1998.

Despite these struggles, Scotland's Euro 2024 qualifying campaign started strong. They managed a remarkable five-match winning streak, including a victory over former champions Spain. However, their form dipped in the latter half of qualifying, leaving them with just one win from their last nine games across all competitions. This solitary victory was a 2-0 win against Gibraltar, which didn't offer much to celebrate.

Scotland hasn't had much luck against Germany in recent years. Since their surprise 1-0 friendly win in 1999, they've failed to win any of their last four encounters, including losses in the Euro 2016 qualifiers with an aggregate score of 5-3. As they arrive in Munich, Scotland hopes to turn their fortunes around against a strong German side.

link.title: Euro 2024 - Germany vs Scotland | Match Info, Preview & Lineup

entry.title: USA vs Ireland 30th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
USA and Ireland will square off in the 30th match of the T20 World Cup 2024. The game is set for June 14, 2024, at Central Broward Regional Park Stadium in Lauderhill, Florida, starting at 8:00 PM IST.

The USA is having a fantastic debut in the T20 World Cup, having defeated Canada and Pakistan to secure 4 points, placing them 2nd on the table. A win against Ireland would secure their spot in the next round.

Ireland, on the other hand, has yet to win a match in this World Cup, having lost to both India and Canada. Their chances of qualifying are slim, but they can still try to help Pakistan by defeating the USA, though it wont be an easy task given the USA's current form.

The pitch at Central Broward Stadium offers a good batting track and batters will be finally able to score runs after New Yorks lethal pitch. Pacers will be able to pick more wickets than spinners as there will be some seam movement. The average innings score will be around 160.

entry.title: Afghanistan vs PNG 29th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Group C is heating up as Afghanistan faces Papua New Guinea in their second-to-last match of the group stage. Afghanistan just needs a win against PNG to knock out New Zealand and secure a spot in the Super 8. On the other hand, PNG, having lost their first two matches, will be aiming for an upset.

Afghanistan kicked off their campaign with a massive 125-run victory over Uganda and then stunned New Zealand. Fazalhaq Farooqi and Rashid Khan shined with the ball, while Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran led the batting charge.

$ads={2}

Papua New Guinea started their tournament with a hard-fought loss to West Indies. Their defeat to Uganda was especially tough, as they had reduced their opponents to 26/5 before a dropped catch shifted the momentum. Now, they'll look to turn their fortunes around against Afghanistan.

The match will be played at the Brian Lara stadium in Trinidad. The pitch will assist the spinners but batters should be able to score runs if they spend some time at the wicket. A score of 160 should be par here given the slow nature of the surface.


Afghanistan Predicted Playing 11
Rahmanullah Gurbaz (wk), Ibrahim Zadran, Najibullah Zadran, Mohammad Nabi, Gulbadin Naib, Azmatullah Omarzai, Rashid Khan (c), Karim Janat, Noor Ahmad, Naveen-ul-Haq, Fazalhaq Farooqi

Papua New Guinea Predicted Playing 11
Tony Ura, Assad Vala (c), Lega Siaka, Sese Bau, Hiri Hiri, Kiplin Doriga (wk), Charles Amini, Norman Vanua, Alei Nao, Chad Soper, John Kariko

link.title: Afghanistan vs PNG 29th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: England vs Oman 28th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
England faces a crucial game as the defending T20 World Cup champions teeter on the edge of an early exit. Jos Buttler and his team must win their match against Oman to stay in the competition and aim to dominate the tournament's newcomers.

England's campaign began with a rain-affected match against Scotland, resulting in no result. A subsequent 36-run defeat to Australia left England with just one point from two games. To advance, England must now convincingly defeat both Oman and Namibia, while hoping Australia defeats Scotland.


Oman, already eliminated from the tournament after a third consecutive loss to Scotland, has nothing left to play for except the role of spoilers against England.

This is a good batting wicket in Antigua which offers some turn but also good carry. The top pace bowlers will take the pitch out of the equation and nail their yorkers or produce strong slower balls to be successful here at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium. A par score will be over 180 in the first innings.


England Predicted Playing 11
Phil Salt, Jos Buttler (c) (wk), Will Jacks, Jonny Bairstow, Moeen Ali, Harry Brook, Liam Livingstone / Sam Curran, Chris Jordan, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid, Mark Wood

Oman Predicted Playing 11
Pratik Athavale (wk), Naseem Khushi, Aqib Ilyas (c), Zeeshan Maqsood, Khalid Kail, Ayaan Khan, Mehran Khan, Rafiullah, Shakeel Ahmed, Kaleemullah, Bilal Khan

link.title: England vs Oman 28th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Bangladesh vs Netherlands 27th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Bangladesh will take on the Netherlands in the 27th match of the T20 World Cup 2024 this Thursday, June 13, at the Arnos Vale Ground in Kingstown, St Vincent. Both teams have secured one win each out of their two matches in Group D so far.

In their last game, Bangladesh played against South Africa. After winning the toss, South Africa chose to bat first, scoring 113 runs for six wickets in 20 overs. Tanzim Hasan Sakib was the standout bowler for Bangladesh, taking three wickets for just 18 runs in his four overs. However, Bangladesh struggled with their batting, losing wickets quickly and managing only 109 runs for seven wickets, falling short by four runs.

The Netherlands also faced South Africa in their previous match. South Africa won the toss and opted to bowl. The Netherlands scored 103 runs for nine wickets in their 20 overs, with Sybrand Engelbrecht top-scoring with 40 runs off 45 deliveries. South Africa chased down the target, reaching 104 runs in 18.5 overs with four wickets remaining. Vivian Kingma and Logan van Beek each took two wickets for the Netherlands.

In T20 internationals, Bangladesh and the Netherlands have played each other four times. Bangladesh has won three of these encounters, while the Netherlands has won one. In T20 World Cup history, Bangladesh has won both matches against the Netherlands.


Bangladesh Predicted Playing 11
Tanzid Hasan, Litton Das (wk), Najmul Hossain Shanto (c), Towhid Hridoy, Shakib Al Hasan, Jaker Ali, Mahmudullah, Rishad Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Tanzim Hasan Sakib, Mustafizur Rahman

entry.title: West Indies vs New Zealand 26th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The West Indies and New Zealand are set to face off in Match 26 of the 2024 T20 World Cup, taking place in Group C at the Brian Lara Stadium. After securing victories against Papua New Guinea and Uganda, the West Indies are aiming for their third consecutive win. 

Meanwhile, New Zealand will be playing their second game of the tournament, hoping to bounce back from a heavy 84-run defeat to Afghanistan. This exciting matchup is scheduled to start in Tarouba, Trinidad on Thursday, June 12th at 8:30 PM local time.

$ads={2}

The West Indies have had a strong start, winning by five wickets and by 134 runs in their first two games. However, facing New Zealand is expected to be a more challenging test. If the West Indies play to their full potential, they stand a good chance of maintaining their unbeaten streak.

New Zealand, on the other hand, will be looking to recover from their disappointing performance against Afghanistan, which resulted in their largest losing margin in T20 World Cup history. Their batting lineup, in particular, struggled in that match, but they are likely to put up a much better fight in this game.


West Indies Predicted Playing 11
Brandon King, Johnson Charles, Nicholas Pooran (wk), Rovman Powell (c), Sherfane Rutherford, Andre Russell, Romario Shepherd, Roston Chase, Akeal Hosein, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie

entry.title: India vs USA 25th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
India (IND) and the United States (USA) are gearing up for an exciting clash in Match 25 of the 2024 T20 World Cup. The match is scheduled for Wednesday, June 12, at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.

Both teams are in excellent form, with India and the US occupying the top two spots in Group A after winning their first two matches.


A victory in this match would significantly boost both teams' chances of advancing to the Super 8s. India, having played both their previous matches at this venue, should have a good grasp of the conditions. Nevertheless, Rohit Sharma and his squad won't underestimate the co-hosts, especially after their remarkable win against Pakistan.

The USA kicked off their campaign with an impressive win over Canada, chasing a target of 195 runs in just 17.4 overs with seven wickets down. They followed this with a thrilling Super Over victory against Pakistan, pulling off one of the biggest upsets in cricket history. It will be fascinating to see how they perform against the inaugural champions on the challenging pitch in New York.


India Predicted Playing 11
Rohit Sharma (c), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh

entry.title: Australia vs Namibia 24th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Australia will face Namibia in the 24th match of the T20 World Cup 2024. This exciting game is set to take place at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in North Sound, Antigua, and will kick off at 6:00 AM IST on June 12.

Australia has been in outstanding form, winning both of their matches so far. Theyll be aiming for a third consecutive win, which would secure their spot in the Super 8s for Mitchell Marsh's team. Australia's performance has been top-notch, living up to their reputation as favorites. They are the only team to have scored over 200 runs in a match in this tournament, and their bowlers have been exceptional in defending their totals.

On the other hand, Namibia has had a mixed run, with a victory against Oman and a loss to Scotland. With two crucial games left against Australia and England, Namibia faces a tough challenge. To move on to the next round, they need to win both matches, a daunting task for the Namibian side.

The wicket will be better for cricket than other venues where batters have struggled. This seems a more settled pitch where big runs can be chased thus captains would prefer to chase.


Australia Predicted Playing 11
David Warner, Travis Head, Mitchell Marsh (c), Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Tim David, Matthew Wade (wk), Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc, Adam Zampa, Josh Hazlewood

entry.title: Nepal vs Sri Lanka 23rd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Match 23 of the 2024 T20 World Cup brings Sri Lanka and Nepal face-to-face at the Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground in Lauderhill on Tuesday evening. 

Both teams are eager for a win, with Sri Lanka having lost their first two games and Nepal also suffering a defeat in their only match so far. The game kicks off on June 12th at 7:30 PM local time.

Sri Lanka has struggled with their batting in the tournament, and their bowlers haven't been able to turn things around either. Despite this, they have a strong bowling lineup, and if their batters step up, they stand a good chance of securing a victory.

Nepal, although defeated by the Netherlands in Dallas, showed resilience with the ball in the second innings. However, they'll face a formidable Sri Lankan bowling attack in this match, and scoring runs against such a high-quality unit will be a significant challenge for them.

This is a good batting pitch as seen in the last T20I here when West Indies chased down a target of 166 with only two wickets down and with 12 balls remaining. There could be some spin but overall there will be good carry for the pace bowlers throughout.

entry.title: Canada vs Pakistan 22nd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Former T20 World Cup champions Pakistan are gearing up for a must-win match against Canada at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium. Babar Azam and his squad need a decisive victory to stay in contention. Meanwhile, Canada is riding high after a win over Ireland in their last game.

Pakistan has had a rough patch, losing their last two matches in the tournament. Their recent defeat came against arch-rivals India, where they couldn't chase down a modest 120-run target. This puts Pakistan in a tight spot, requiring them to win their remaining matches and boost their run rate to advance.

On the other hand, Canada started their campaign with a loss to the USA but bounced back strongly with a historic win over Irelandtheir first ever in an ICC T20 World Cup. With this momentum, the Canadian team is confident and eager to upset Pakistan's chances of reaching the Super 8 stage.

The pitch at Nassau County Ground offers a bowling track with a lot of help for the pacers as there is a good amount of seam and swing movement which becomes a nightmare for the batters. The average innings score is around 110.

entry.title: South Africa vs Bangladesh 21st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
South Africa is aiming for their third consecutive victory at the 2024 T20 World Cup as they face Bangladesh, who are also eyeing their second win in a row. 

The match will take place at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York, marking Match 21 of the tournament in Group D. Let's delve into this upcoming game scheduled for Monday, June 10th, starting at 10:30 am.

$ads={2}

In their recent match against the Netherlands, South Africa found themselves in a tough spot at 12/4 while chasing 104 runs for victory. However, their team displayed resilience and skill, managing to secure a win. This victory will surely boost their confidence going into the upcoming match.

Bangladesh, on the other hand, faced criticism after losing their first two T20Is against USA. Despite this, they bounced back with a win in the final match of the series and followed it up with another victory against Sri Lanka. With a strong bowling lineup, Bangladesh aims to pose challenges for South Africa in this encounter.

entry.title: Oman vs Scotland 20th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
We're heading into Match 20 of the 2024 T20 World Cup, and this Sunday, Oman and Scotland will face off in North Sound, Antigua. Oman hasn't secured a win yet in the tournament after playing two matches, while Scotland has won one and lost one. The game kicks off at 15:00 local time on June 9th at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium.

Oman finds themselves at the bottom of Group B after losing both their previous games. To stand a chance at reaching the Super 8s, they really need to win this match. However, Scotland has historically proven to be tough competition for them.

Scotland has performed solidly in their matches so far, with a no-result against England and a win against Namibia. They're likely feeling confident heading into this match and should have the experience needed to secure another win.

We usually see this pitch rewarding spinners and pace bowlers who give the pitch the chance to make a difference. Here at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, any score of over 165-170 will be competitive.
