entry.title: India vs Pakistan 19th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
In week two of the 2024 T20 World Cup, fans are gearing up for an epic showdown between cricket giants India and Pakistan. The match is set to take place at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York on Sunday afternoon, promising an electrifying atmosphere.

This rivalry between India and Pakistan is one of the fiercest in sports, and with a temporary 34,000-seat stadium in East Meadow, the excitement is palpable. It's being touted as the 'Super Bowl on steroids', and cricket enthusiasts are eagerly anticipating every moment.

$ads={2}

Last week, Rahul Dravid announced his decision to step down as the head coach of the Indian T20 team after the tournament. Leading his team to victory here would be a dream farewell for the batting legend, aiming for India's first T20 title since 2007.

However, there's a bit of uncertainty surrounding Rohit Sharma's participation due to an injury. While there's no definite decision yet, Yashasvi Jaiswal might step in if Sharma is unable to play.

Virat Kohli, fresh from winning his second orange cap at the IPL, is likely to continue opening the innings for India, despite a disappointing start in their first match. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant seems to have solidified his spot at number three after impressive performances in warm-up games and against Ireland.

For Pakistan, Babar Azam has been a consistent performer at the top of the batting order. But to pose a serious challenge to India, they'll need significant contributions from Mohammad Rizwan, Usman Khan, and Fakhar Zaman, especially after their top-order struggled in the previous match against the US.

Considering the pitch conditions in Nassau County, which are expected to favor pacers, Pakistan will rely heavily on Afridi's bowling prowess. The left-arm speedster has been impressive in powerplays, having taken the second-most wickets in T20s since 2019, just behind New Zealand's Tim Southee.


India squad:
Rohit Sharma (c), Hardik Pandya, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant, Sanju Samson, Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj

Pakistan squad:
Babar Azam (c), Abrar Ahmed, Azam Khan, Fakhar Zaman, Haris Rauf, Iftikhar Ahmed, Imad Wasim, Mohammad Abbas Afridi, Mohammad Amir, Mohammad Rizwan, Naseem Shah, Saim Ayub, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Usman Khan

link.title: India vs Pakistan 19th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: West Indies vs Uganda 18th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Two old rivals meet again on Saturday afternoon in Bridgetown, Barbados, as Australia takes on England in Match 17 of Group B. Australia overcame a few tough moments to secure a 39-run victory against Oman on Wednesday, while England's match with Scotland ended without a result on Tuesday.

Strong performances from David Warner and Marcus Stoinis were key in Australia's win over Oman, and there's plenty more potential within this Australian side, especially in their batting lineup. The Aussies will be highly motivated to defeat the reigning champions in this encounter, bolstered by their strong squad.


England, on the other hand, cannot afford another winless game after their opening match against Scotland was abandoned due to weather. Falling short again could embolden other nations to vie for second place. However, England's players often deliver their best performances in T20I clashes against Australia.

The pace bowlers found considerable success on this pitch on Thursday evening, but top spinners in this game are also likely to extract turn from the surface. The team batting first will aim to post a total of at least 185-195 to remain competitive.


Australia Predicted Playing 11
David Warner, Travis Head, Mitchell Marsh (c), Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Tim David, Matthew Wade (wk), Mitchell Starc, Nathan Ellis / Pat Cummins, Adam Zampa, Josh Hazlewood

England Predicted Playing 11
Jos Buttler (c) (wk), Phil Salt, Will Jacks, Jonny Bairstow, Harry Brook, Liam Livingstone, Moeen Ali, Chris Jordan, Mark Wood, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid

link.title: West Indies vs Uganda 18th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Portugal vs Croatia - Friendly Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
Portugal is gearing up for this summer's European Championship with an exciting friendly against fellow Euro 2024 contenders Croatia on Saturday evening.

Roberto Martinez's team recently secured a 4-2 victory over Finland, while Croatia heads into this match after a 3-0 win against North Macedonia. Cristiano Ronaldo, who missed the game against Finland, is expected to be back in the squad and likely to start.


Martinez plans to rotate his squad from Tuesday's match, with Diogo Costa, Bernardo Silva, Bruno Fernandes, and Diogo Dalot all set to start. Since Portugal has one more friendly before Euro 2024 kicks off, Martinez will continue to experiment with his lineup. However, Antonio Silva and Ruben Dias are expected to stay as the central defensive duo.

Croatia, under Dalic's guidance, is also shaping up for the European Championship. It wouldn't be surprising to see a lineup similar to the one that faced North Macedonia. There will likely be some changes at halftime, but key players like Mateo Kovacic, Ivan Perisic, and Andrej Kramaric are expected to keep their spots.


A significant change for Croatia will be in defense, with Josko Gvardiol, who missed the North Macedonia game, expected to start.

link.title: Portugal vs Croatia - Friendly Match prediction, lineups

entry.title: Netherlands vs S. Africa 16th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
South Africa will be seeking revenge when they face the Netherlands in a crucial T20 World Cup 2024 clash. The last time these two teams met in an ICC tournament, the Dutch team delivered a crushing defeat to the South Africans, eliminating them from the 2022 T20 World Cup.

The Netherlands (NED) started strong in this year's tournament, easily defeating Nepal in a one-sided match. Scott Edwards, their captain, is pleased with the team's performance and hopes his batters can maintain their momentum to secure a third consecutive win against South Africa.

$ads={2}
On the other side, Aiden Markram is counting on the South African (SA) team to replicate their dominant performance against Sri Lanka. Anrich Nortje was particularly impressive, taking four wickets and dismantling the Sri Lankan batting lineup, bowling them out for just 77 runs.

Bowlers are definitely enjoying themselves on this surface. The drop-in pitch is still settling, causing significant ball movement and making batting quite challenging.

After two matches and four innings, no team has managed to score over 100 runs. Both pacers and spinners are successfully taking wickets, so batters need to take their time before going for big shots. The par score is expected to be around 130.


Netherlands Predicted Playing 11
Michael Levitt, Max O'Dowd, Vikramjit Singh, Sybrand Engelbrecht, Bas de Leede, Scott Edwards (c & wk), Teja Nidamanuru, Logan van Beek, Tim Pringle, Paul van Meekeren, Vivian Kingma

South Africa Predicted Playing 11
Quinton de Kock (wk), Reeza Hendricks, Aiden Markram (c), Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Tristan Stubbs, Marco Jansen, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Ottneil Baartman

link.title: Netherlands vs S. Africa 16th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Sri Lanka vs Bangladesh 15th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
In the upcoming match of the 2024 T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka will face off against Bangladesh in Dallas, Texas, on Friday evening. In their last match against South Africa, Sri Lanka struggled, posting their lowest T20I total and ultimately losing by 6 wickets with 22 balls remaining.

On the other hand, Bangladesh will be stepping onto the field for the first time in this tournament. The action kicks off at 8:30 PM local time at the Grand Prairie Stadium on June 7th.

$ads={2}

Despite their rough start in the tournament, many observers believe Sri Lanka had a tough task batting first on the pitch in New York. They'll be eager to turn the page on that match and make a fresh start in this upcoming encounter.

Bangladesh, on the other hand, faced a setback after losing their series to the USA. This led some pundits to dismiss their chances early on in the tournament. However, Bangladesh boasts some strong batsmen in their lineup, and if Mustafizur Rahman can bring his A-game with the ball, he could prove to be quite a challenge for the opposition.

The pitch is a little two-paced in Dallas but there will still be plenty of opportunities for six-hitting for batters who are in good form. Spinners are unlikely to get much turn from the surface at the Grand Prairie Stadium and a par score will be around 175-180.


Sri Lanka Predicted Playing 11
Pathum Nissanks, Kusal Mendis (wk), Kamindu Mendis, Wanindu Hasaranga (c), Sadeera Samarawickrama, Charith Asalanka, Angelo Mathews, Dasun Shanaka, Maheesh Theekshana, Matheesha Pathirana, Nuwan Thushara

Bangladesh Predicted Playing 11
Tanzid Hasan, Soumya Sarkar, Litton Das (wk), Najmul Hossain Shanto (c), Shakib Al Hasan, Towhid Hridoy, Mahmudullah, Rishad Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman, Shoriful Islam, Taskin Ahmed

entry.title: New Zealand vs Afghanistan 14th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
New Zealand is gearing up to face Afghanistan in the 14th match of the T20 World Cup 2024. The game is scheduled to take place at the Providence Stadium in Guyana, kicking off at 5:00 AM IST on June 8.

New Zealand has a reputation for being a consistent performer in ICC events, consistently making it to the top 4. Despite not clinching an ICC tournament victory yet, they're considered strong contenders for the title in this edition and will be looking for a winning start.

$ads={2}

Afghanistan, though ranked lower than New Zealand, shouldn't be underestimated. They showed their strength in their first game against Uganda, securing a massive victory by 125 runs.

While New Zealand might seem stronger on paper, they'll likely face a tough challenge from Afghanistan's spinners. How they handle this challenge could ultimately determine the outcome of the match.

This is not an easy wicket to bat. The new ball has done a bit while the slow nature of the surface has made spinners look very threatening. Any score of 150-160 can be very challenging to chase.


New Zealand Predicted Playing 11
Kane Williamson (C), Finn Allen, Devon Conway, Daryl Mitchell, Jimmy Neesham, Glenn Phillips, Rachin Ravindra, Mitchell Santner, Tim Southee, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult

entry.title: Canada vs Ireland 13th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Canada will face Ireland in the 13th game of the T20 World Cup 2024. The match will take place at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York, starting at 8:00 PM IST on June 7.

Both teams are in a must-win situation. Canada is coming off a tough seven-wicket loss to the USA, despite scoring 194-5, thanks to Aaron Jones' outstanding performance that led the USA to victory.

$ads={2}
Ireland didn't fare much better, suffering a heavy defeat to India in their opening game. They struggled against the Indian bowlers and were all out for just 96, with India securing an easy win by eight wickets, led by Rohit Sharma's half-century.

A loss for either team will make it very difficult for them to qualify for the Super 8s, as they need to finish in the top 2 of their group to advance to the next round.

The pitch at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium has been quite lively. It's been favorable to both fast bowlers and spinners, with the ball moving in both directions and spinners getting good turn and grip. There's also been some inconsistent bounce. Given these conditions, a score of 140-150 could be enough to secure a win.


Canada Predicted Playing 11
Shreyas Movva (wk), Saad Bin Zafar (c), Aaron Johnson, Navneet Dhaliwal, , Nicholas Kirton, Dilpreet Singh, Dillon Heyliger, Jeremy Gordon, Pargat Singh, Nikhil Dutta, Kaleem Sana

entry.title: Namibia vs Scotland 12th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Namibia and Scotland will face off for the fourth time in T20I cricket during Match 12 of the 2024 T20 World Cup on Thursday afternoon. The match will take place at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados, on June 6th.

Namibia is coming into this game on a high after a thrilling Super Over victory against Oman on Sunday. This win should boost their confidence as they look to build on their strong record against Scotland and aim for their second win in a row.

$ads={2}

Scotland, on the other hand, had a no-result against England on Tuesday but made an impressive showing by scoring 90/0 in just 10 overs. Their opening batters put up a great fight against the defending champions' bowling attack, and theyll be looking to carry that momentum into this match.

Batters were able to get full value for their shots in Tuesdays shortened game and any delivery with pace on will come onto the bat nicely. However, slower balls and flighted spin deliveries will die in the surface and batters may need to push those deliveries into the gaps as opposed to target the boundaries. Any score over 180 will be competitive.

entry.title: Pakistan vs USA 11th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The USA will face Pakistan in the 11th game of the T20 World Cup 2024. The match is set for June 6 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, starting at 8:15 PM NST.

For the first time in T20 World Cup history, the Pakistan cricket team enters the tournament with lowered expectations. They haven't been in great form recently, having lost two home games to New Zealand's second-string team and suffering a defeat to Ireland in one of the T20I matches. 

$ads={2}

Additionally, they were beaten 2-0 by England in the series leading up to the World Cup. Key batters Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan haven't been performing well, and while the bowling lineup looks strong on paper, the players have struggled in recent series.

On the other hand, the USA comes into this game with momentum, following an impressive win over Canada. They comfortably chased down a target of 195, thanks to standout performances by Aaron Jones and Andries Gous. The USA team is strong and very capable of causing an upset.

This pitch at the Grand Prairie could be tricky. Over 200 runs were scored in the game but we are not sure how the pitch will behave if the match is played on a different strip. So far, pitches have behaved differently in different matches and mostly they have been bowling friendly.


USA Predicted Playing 11
Monank Patel (c & wk), Steven Taylor, Andries Gous, Aaron Jones, Corey Anderson, Harmeet Singh, Nitish Kumar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Ali Khan, Jasdeep Singh, Saurabh Netravalkar

Pakistan Predicted Playing 11
Babar Azam (C), Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Fakhar Zaman, Usman Khan, Azam Khan, Iftikhar Ahmed, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Afridi, Naseem Shah, Haris Rauf, Abrar Ahmed

entry.title: Nepal vs UAE - Fifa World Cup 2026 Qualifier
entry.content:
Nepal is facing UAE today in the qualifying match under FIFA World Cup 2026. The match will start at 9:45 PM Nepali time at Prince Mohammad Bin Fahd Stadium in Dammam, Saudi Arabia.

After the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) expressed interest in the condition of the field and the security system, stating that Dashrath Stadium is unfit to host the World Cup Qualifiers, after writing to ANFA to decide a neutral venue, both matches will be played in Saudi Arabia. Since Nepal could not host the match, Saudi Arabia accepted to host this match for Nepal.


The match between Nepal and Yemen is also being held at the same stadium. Nepal, which is in Group 'H', had suffered defeat in all four matches earlier. Nepal lost 4-0 against UAE and 2-0 against Yemen. Similarly, Nepal lost the first match against Bahrain by 5-0 and the second match by 3-0.

The young forward Ayush Ghalan, who was out of the football team recently, has also returned to the team that will play the last two matches. Although he was not in the initial team, he was included in the final team. Similarly, Ashish Rai from Nepal Police Club is also included in the team.


Dinesh Henjan and Fatteman Ghale, who were on England tour last time, are not in the team due to injuries. Forward Anjan Bisht is also not in the team due to injury. Anant Tamang, who missed the England tour due to a similar injury, has returned to the team.

link.title: Nepal vs UAE - Fifa World Cup 2026 Qualifier

entry.title: Australia vs Oman 10th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
On Wednesday evening, cricket fans will witness an exciting encounter as Australia takes on Oman for the first time in international cricket. This showdown is set to unfold in Match 10 of the 2024 T20 World Cup, hosted in Bridgetown, Barbados. 

For Australia, this marks the beginning of their journey in the competition, while Oman aims to bounce back from a tough Super Over loss to Namibia in Match 3.The action kicks off at the Kensington Oval at 8:30 PM local time on June 6th, and anticipation is high for this Group B fixture.

$ads={2}

Australia, fresh off their Cricket World Cup victory in India, boasts a formidable squad and aims to clinch both white-ball World Cup trophies. With their strength and depth, they're primed for success in this tournament. Expectations are high, and they're gearing up for a dominant performance.

Meanwhile, Oman came agonizingly close to a victorious start against Namibia. Recovering from such a narrow defeat can be challenging, especially facing off against one of the tournament's powerhouses. It's bound to be a tough evening for Oman as they go up against one of the strongest sides in the competition.

As the teams prepare to take the field, all eyes are on this clash, promising an exciting battle between the established might of Australia and the resilience of Oman.

entry.title: PNG vs Uganda 9th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024.
entry.content:
Papua New Guinea and Uganda are set to clash in the 9th match of the T20 World Cup 2024, and it's shaping up to be an exciting showdown. The match is slated to happen at Providence Stadium in Guyana on June 5th, kicking off at 5:15 AM NST on June 6th.

In their previous matches, both teams faced tough defeats. Papua New Guinea fell short against West Indies, while Uganda suffered a significant loss against Afghanistan. Now, they're both eager to bounce back and secure their first points in the tournament.


Assad Vala will be leading the charge for Papua New Guinea, while Brian Masaba will be at the helm for Uganda. It's a crucial moment for both teams to showcase their skills and turn the tide in their favor.

As anticipation builds for the PNG vs UGA match, fans and experts alike are eagerly awaiting the outcome. Stay tuned as we delve into detailed predictions for this exciting clash in the T20 World Cup 2024.

entry.title: India vs Ireland 8th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024.
entry.content:
India is set to face Ireland in the 8th game of the T20 World Cup 2024. This exciting match will take place at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York, starting at 8:15 PM NST on June 5.

India aims to kick off their T20 World Cup campaign with a win, especially after their dominant victory over Bangladesh in the warm-up game. Although India is widely favored to win, Ireland shouldn't be underestimated.


The Irish team has proven their ability to cause upsets, having recently defeated Pakistan in a T20I. If they perform well, they could pose a serious challenge to India.Led by Rohit Sharma, India might view this match as relatively straightforward.

The team's spinners are expected to be their biggest asset, as the conditions are likely to favor spin bowling. Additionally, Virat Kohli's role will be crucial. He has the ability to anchor the innings and help set a competitive total of 160-170 runs, which should be defendable for India.

This pitch at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium is low and slow. It helps the fast bowlers with the new ball and spinners will also be successful here. A score of 170 should be a winning total here.


India Predicted Playing 11
Yashasvi Jaiswal, Rohit Sharma (C), Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj/Arshdeep Singh

Ireland Predicted Playing 11

entry.title: Nepal vs Netherlands 7th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The T20 World Cup 2024 is off to an electrifying start, and fans are in for another treat with the upcoming clash between the Netherlands and Nepal at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

The Netherlands has been one of the fastest-rising teams in international cricket. Their standout performances in the 2022 T20 World Cup and the 2023 ODI World Cup have earned them a growing fan base. Twice now, they've pulled off stunning upsets against South Africa, proving they're a force to be reckoned with.

On the other side, Nepal boasts one of the youngest squads in the tournament, led by the talented Rohit Paudel. Players like Kushal Malla, Dipendra Singh Airee, and Asif Sheikh are among the brightest young stars in Nepali cricket, and they're eager to make their mark on the world stage.

This match promises to be a thrilling contest as both teams look to showcase their skills and continue their upward trajectories in international cricket.

entry.title: England vs Scotland 6th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
England and Scotland are facing off in Match 6 of the 2024 T20 World Cup at 11:30 Nepali local time in Bridgetown, Barbados on Tuesday morning. This game follows the kickoff match between Namibia and Oman at the Kensington Oval on Sunday evening. 

Let's take a closer look at what to expect from this match.It's a local rivalry as England, the defending champions, take on Scotland. Despite the potential for surprises in cricket, England, led by Buttler, seem to have the edge with their strong performance in the recent series against Pakistan. 

Match delayed due to rain (Scotland opt to bat)

$ads={2}

They've shown prowess with both batting and bowling.On the other hand, Scotland has been steadily improving as an international team. 

However, they often lack a standout player who can turn the tide in a tight match against a formidable opponent. While they're expected to put up a good fight, the odds of them clinching a victory seem slim.

entry.title: Uganda vs Afghanistan 5th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Afghanistan and Uganda are set to face off in the fifth match of the T20 World Cup 2024. The game will take place at the Providence Stadium in Guyana, kicking off at 6:15 AM NST on June 4.

While Afghanistan might seem like the stronger team on paper, anything can happen once the teams hit the field for their T20 World Cup opener. Just yesterday, Papua New Guinea gave West Indies a real run for their money, and Oman nearly defended a low score of 109 against Namibia. 

$ads={2}

It's becoming evident that every match in this World Cup is unpredictable, even when a supposedly weaker team is involved.Afghanistan boasts an impressive lineup, featuring skilled batsmen, talented pacers, and game-changing spinners. 

If they play up to their potential, they stand a good chance of winning the World Cup. On the other hand, Uganda might draw inspiration from Papua New Guinea's performance against West Indies, believing that with their best effort, they could cause an upset.

entry.title: Sri Lanka vs South Africa 4th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Sri Lanka is set to take on South Africa in the fourth match of the ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2024 at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York on Monday, June 3.

Both teams, placed in Group D alongside the Netherlands, Nepal, and Bangladesh, are eager to start their campaigns with a win. Sri Lanka, led by spin all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga, is relying heavily on their strong spin unit and the experience of Angelo Mathews, who is making his sixth T20 World Cup appearance.


Meanwhile, South Africa, captained by Aiden Markram, boasts a formidable batting lineup with top-class finishers like David Miller, Heinrich Klaasen, and Tristan Stubbs. Despite their history of reaching knockout stages, South Africa has yet to secure a World Cup title. This match is crucial for both teams as they aim to gain early momentum in the tournament.

The venue, being a new addition to the international cricket scene, adds an extra layer of intrigue as both teams will need to quickly adapt to the conditions. Fans can expect a thrilling contest between Sri Lankas spin prowess and South Africas batting strength.

Kusal Mendis, Pathum Nissanka, Sadeera Samarawickrama, Angelo Mathews, Dhananjaya De Silva, Wanindu Hasaranga (c), Charith Asalanka, Nuwan Thushara, Matheesha Pathirana, Dushmantha Chameera, Maheesh Theekshana

entry.title: Namibia vs Oman 3rd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
In Match 3 of the 2024 T20 World Cup, Namibia faces off against Oman at 8:30 PM local time on Sunday. Namibia, aiming to surpass their first-round exit in 2022, will take on Oman, who are making their third World Cup appearance after participating in 2016 and 2021. 

The match will be held at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados, on June 2nd.Namibia's squad features a mix of six new players and nine returning from the 2022 World Cup. 

$ads={2}

This combination of fresh talent and experience will be crucial as they strive to advance from a tough group. They are considered strong contenders to win this match.

Oman, coming off a strong performance in the ACC Mens Premier Cup where they reached the final before losing to the UAE in April, has evolved into a formidable T20I team. However, they struggled in their last series against Namibia, which could influence the outcome of this clash.

entry.title: West Indies vs PNG 2nd Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The West Indies are set to face PNG in the second game of the T20 World Cup. The match will take place at the Providence Stadium in Guyana, starting at 10:30 AM LOCAL on June 2.

Entering the T20 World Cup 2024, the West Indies are among the favorites to clinch the title. The hosts have been in stellar form leading up to the tournament, coming off an impressive series win against South Africa and a victory over Australia in a warm-up game.


While most teams rely on collective performances to succeed in big tournaments, the West Indies have such explosive power in their lineup that just a few players having a good day can topple any opponent. Their batting lineup is arguably the best in the tournament.

For PNG, overcoming the West Indies will be a monumental challenge. Although upsets are not uncommon in T20 cricket, PNG will need to deliver an exceptional performance to test this formidable West Indies team.

entry.title: USA vs Canada 1st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
The T20 World Cup 2024 is set to start with a thrilling match between the United States and Canada at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Sunday, June 2. 

This year's tournament is the largest ever, promising plenty of excitement and high-quality cricket. Adding to the fanfare, there will be an opening ceremony held in Guyana just before the second game, setting the stage for an unforgettable event.


The United States team, captained by Monank Patel, is determined to make a strong impression. Historically, the U.S. has had the upper hand in this North American rivalry, winning five out of the seven encounters against Canada. 

This gives the team a boost of confidence as they prepare to take on their neighbors on such a grand stage.
On the other hand, Canada is not to be underestimated. They come into the tournament with their spirits high, especially after a notable victory over Nepal in one of their warm-up matches. 

This win has bolstered their confidence, and they are eager to carry this momentum into their campaign opener against the U.S.

Both teams are well aware of the significance of this match, not just in terms of progressing in the tournament but also for regional pride. Fans can expect a fiercely contested game as both sides strive to make a strong start in the T20 World Cup. 


With the U.S. looking to continue their historical dominance and Canada aiming to build on their recent successes, the stage is set for an electrifying opener.

link.title: USA vs Canada 1st Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: India vs Bangladesh Warm-Up Matches - T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
India are preparing for their only friendly match ahead of the 2024 T20 World Cup, which will be played against Bangladesh on Saturday, June 1 at the new Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.

The match will give India a valuable opportunity to understand the pitch conditions ahead of the first three matches of the group stage in New York.

$ads={2}

It is not yet clear if Virat Kohli will play or not, but Rohit Sharma will have a clear idea of his playing combination and will not experiment much before the tournament begins.

The key things to look out for in India include the competition between Mohammed Siraj and Arshdeep Singh and the decision between Sanju Samson and Rishabh Pant for the first-choice goalkeeper.

On the other hand, Bangladesh lost the first warm-up match against the United States due to bad weather.
This match will not have official T20 status, so the stats from this match will not count towards the players' T20 records.

Rohit Sharma(c), Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Sanju Samson, Hardik Pandya, Rishabh Pant(w), Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh, Yuzvendra Chahal

entry.title: Kings Cup | Final - Al Hilal vs Al Nassr | Match Info, Preview & Lineup
entry.content:
Al Nassr will face Saudi Pro League champions Al Hilal in the King Cup of Champions final at the King Abdullah Sports City Stadium in Jeddah this Friday.

Al Hilal won the league title with three days to go and remain unbeaten with 31 wins and three draws. Cristiano Ronaldo and his side finished second, 14 points ahead of Al Hilal.
Live Match - Animation Tracker

$ads={2}

Ronaldo, 39, scored 35 goals in a brilliant performance, surpassing Morocco's Abderrazak Hamdallah's record of 34 goals in a season, which Hamdallah set with Al Nassr in the 2018-19 season.

Goals from Ronaldo and Sadio Mane helped Al Nassr reach the final after beating Al Khaleej 3-1 in the semi-finals. Meanwhile, 10-man Al Hilal beat Al Ittihad 2-1 despite the dismissal of Sergej Milinkovic-Savic just before half-time.

After winning the championship and the Saudi Arabian Super Cup, Al Hilal are looking to win the national triple crown. Al Nassr will be hoping to take advantage of their last chance to win a trophy this season, having already won the Arab Club Champions Cup this season.


Al Nassr predicted XI: Ospina, Al Ghannam, Al Amri, Laporte, Telles, Alkhaibari, Ayman Ahmed, Al Hassan, Brozovic, Mane, Ronaldo

Al Hilal predicted XI: Bono, Abdulhamid, Koulibaly, Al Bulaihi, Al Shahrani, Neves, Kanno, Michael, Lodi, Malcom, Mitrovic

entry.title: Borussia Dortmund vs. Real Madrid - UCL 2024 Final
entry.content:
Wembley Stadium is set for a thrilling Champions League final on Saturday evening, as underdogs Borussia Dortmund take on the seasoned Real Madrid.

Dortmund seeks their second Champions League title after a 27-year wait, having defeated Paris Saint-Germain in the semifinals. Real Madrid, aiming for their 15th title, made a dramatic comeback against Bayern Munich to reach the final.

Real Madrid will miss David Alaba (ACL injury) and Aurelien Tchouameni (foot injury), with Nacho Fernandez expected to captain the side in his final game. Toni Kroos, playing his last match for Real, will line up with Eduardo Camavinga and Federico Valverde in midfield. Andriy Lunin's flu makes Thibaut Courtois the clear starter in goal.

entry.title: Nepal vs USA Warm-Up Matches - T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
After an embarrassing 63-run defeat to Canada in the first warm-up match, Nepal will face the USA in the second friendly match on May 30.

Coming off a historic 2-1 victory over full member country Bangladesh, Monank Patel will lead the United States into action against Nepal at Grand Prairie Stadium on Thursday. However, there is a possibility of thunderstorms and tornadoes on game day.

The previous match with Bangladesh was abandoned without a ball being bowled, and another match is likely to be abandoned. Bangladesh will face India in their next and final friendly on Saturday, just before the group stage games. 

The host team has been strengthened with the inclusion of former New Zealand star Corey Anderson and former Indian under-19 player Harmeet Singh.

The match between Nepal and America will be played at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium at 9:15 pm Nepal time.

entry.title: Inter Miami vs. Atlanta United - Match Preview, Prediction
entry.content:
If Inter Miami wins or draws against Atlanta United at Chase Stadium on Wednesday, they will set a franchise record for the longest unbeaten run in MLS in a single season.

A 2-1 win over the Vancouver Whitecaps on Saturday moved the Herons to the top of the Supporters Shield standings, just one point ahead of FC Cincinnati. In contrast, Atlanta United's winless run reached nine games with a 1-0 home loss to Los Angeles FC. 


Miami lost Diego Gomez (ankle sprain) and Robbie Robinson (knee problem) over the weekend, and Facundo Frias is out for the season with a torn ACL.

Ian Frey is close to returning from an ACL injury, Serhiy Krivtsov played Saturday's entire match despite a previous shift, and Federico Redondo made his first appearance since an ACL injury, replacing Benjamin Cremaschi in the second half. Robert Taylor scored his third goal of the season and Leonardo Campana scored the winner for the second consecutive game.

Atlanta will be without starting goalkeeper Brad Guzan, who received a red card last week. Noah Cobb missed the last game with an ankle injury and leading scorer Giorgos Gikomakis is out with a strained hamstring. Nicolas Firmino is a doubt after twisting his hip during the US Open Cup win against the Charleston Battery.


Tyler Wolfe is dealing with an MCL sprain, and 2022 World Cup champion Thiago Almada made his first appearance since the loss to FC Cincinnati last Saturday, coming on as a second-half substitute.

Derrick Williams returned from a calf injury last weekend and replaced Stian Rod Gregersen for the final 18 minutes and stoppage time.

link.title: Inter Miami vs. Atlanta United - Match Preview, Prediction

entry.title: Olympiacos vs. Fiorentina - Match Preview, Prediction
entry.content:
Greek giants Olympiacos take on last year's runners-up Fiorentina this Wednesday evening for the 2023-24 Europa Conference League final in Athens.

The AEK Arena, where the match will take place, is just 10 miles from Olympiacos' home. Fiorentina, seeking revenge for last year's painful defeat in Prague, will be aiming to spoil the party. 


After nine days of preparation, Olympiacos coach Jose Luis Mendilibar has a fully fit squad at his disposal, including former Fiorentina forward Stevan Jovetic who recently recovered from injury.

Jovetic, who scored 40 goals for Fiorentina between 2008 and 2013, scored a late goal in the derby against Panathinaikos to secure Europa Conference League qualification for Olympiacos, although he is unlikely to start. Instead, Daniel Podence and Kostas Fortounis are expected to support star striker Ayoub El Kaabi, the top scorer in European competitions this season.


Goalkeepers Konstantinos Tzoulakis, recently called up to the Greek national team, and Panagiotis Retsos will partner David Carmo in defence. Only Nelson Abe and Gelson Martins will not be in the squad, while Argentine full-back Francisco Ortega is back to compete for a starting spot with Quini.

link.title: Olympiacos vs. Fiorentina - Match Preview, Prediction

entry.title: USA vs Bangladesh Warm-Up Matches - T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Bangladesh cricket team is set to take on USA in a warm-up match for the T20 World Cup on Tuesday, May 28 at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

The warm-up matches for the T20 World Cup 2024 began on Monday, May 27, with Canada playing against Nepal at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas.

Match Cancelled !!

The warm-up match between Bangladesh and the USA at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas today has been canceled due to the conditions of the facilities following the adverse weather that has affected the area.#BCB #Cricket #BANvUSA #BDCricket #Bangladesh pic.twitter.com/CnRolbAtzz

Bangladesh Cricket (@BCBtigers) May 28, 2024

There will be a total of 16 practice matches ahead of the T20 World Cup, starting on Saturday, June 1. The first official match will see the co-hosts, the United States, take on their North American rivals, Canada. , in Texas.

The practice matches will be held at various venues, including the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Dallas, Texas, Broward County Stadium in Florida, Queens Park Oval in Port of Spain and the Brian Lara Cricket Academy in Taruba, Trinidad and Tobago.

entry.title: Al Nassr vs Al Ittihad - Match Preview, Prediction
entry.content:
In the upcoming match of the Saudi Professional League's 34th round, Al Nassr is scheduled to clash with Al-Ittihad at 20:00 Central European Time. This encounter holds significant importance for both teams, albeit for different reasons.

Al Nassr, a team boasting the presence of Cristiano Ronaldo, sits comfortably in the league standings, occupying the coveted second position. With an impressive tally of 79 points amassed over 33 matches, they have established a commanding 17-point lead over their nearest rival. 

Live Match - Animation Tracker

$ads={2}

However, despite this remarkable feat, they find themselves trailing the league leaders by 14 points. With their position secured, Al Nassr aims to further solidify their standing in the league hierarchy and perhaps even mount a late-season challenge to the top spot.

On the other side of the pitch, Al-Ittihad enters this fixture with aspirations yet to be fulfilled. Currently positioned in fifth place with 54 points, they are just two points shy of clinching the fourth spot in the league standings. With this coveted position comes the opportunity to secure a place in the AFC Cup for the upcoming season. 

Thus, Al-Ittihad finds themselves in a precarious yet hopeful position, eager to secure a victory that could propel them into the desired top-four spots.

As the match unfolds, fans and pundits alike will be keenly observing the performance of both teams. For Al Nassr, it's about maintaining their stronghold on the second spot and perhaps inching closer to the summit. 


For Al-Ittihad, it's a battle for advancement, a chance to secure a ticket to continental competition and elevate their standing in the league. With stakes high and ambitions driving both sides, this clash promises to be a spectacle filled with intensity, skill, and the relentless pursuit of victory.

link.title: Al Nassr vs Al Ittihad - Match Preview, Prediction

entry.title: Nepal vs Canada Warm-Up Matches - T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Nepal is set to face Canada in their opening match of the warm-up session for the ICC T20 Cricket World Cup 2024. According to the official ICC schedule, Nepal will play against Canada and the USA in their designated warm-up matches, yet again not having the opportunity to compete against full member nations. 

Join Our Telegram For Live Link

$ads={2}

This has been a point of contention for Nepal, as playing against higher-ranked teams could provide valuable experience and exposure.

In preparation for these crucial warm-up games, Nepal has been actively honing their skills. The team recently played a series of practice matches in the USA, which allowed them to acclimatize to different playing conditions and refine their strategies. 

Additionally, they engaged in a three-match T20 series in the West Indies, providing them with further competitive experience against international teams.


These preparations are vital for Nepal as they aim to perform well in the ICC T20 Cricket World Cup 2024, and the warm-up matches against Canada and the USA will be critical in assessing their readiness for the main tournament.

link.title: Nepal vs Canada Warm-Up Matches - T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: SRH vs KKR Final, IPL 2024 - Match Prediction, Playing XI
entry.content:
After more than two months of intense cricket and 73 exciting matches, the 2024 Indian Premier League season has reached its long-awaited conclusion. The grand final will be contested between Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at the prestigious Chepauk Stadium in Chennai. 

In their previous meetings this season, KKR emerged victorious against SRH on both occasions, underscoring their dominance over the Pat Cummins-led side.



$ads={2}

Kolkata Knight Riders have performed brilliantly this season and topped the league standings with 20 points from 14 matches. Their record consists of nine wins, three losses and two without a result, securing their place in the first qualifier. 

In that crucial game, KKR once again defeated SRH and won by eight wickets with brilliant half-centuries from Shreyas Iyer and Venkatesh Iyer. Full of confidence and form, the two-time IPL champions are determined to bring the coveted trophy back to Eden Gardens for the third time.

On the other hand, Sunrisers Hyderabad have also had a commendable season and finished second in the league standings. They defeated Rajasthan Royals by a narrow margin to book their place in the playoffs. Although they faltered in the first Qualifier against KKR, Pat Cummins and his team showed resilience and skill by dominating Rajasthan Royals in the second Qualifier and booked their place in the final. 

With a lineup of free-scoring batsmen and bowlers in top form, the 2016 champions are at the top of their game. This final is not only a chance for SRH to claim the title, but also for their captain to etch his name in the history books as one of the greatest leaders of modern cricket.


The stage is set for an exciting climax to the IPL 2024 season as both the teams will compete for the championship. KKR, with their brutal brand of cricket, will be looking to maintain their winning streak against SRH, while Sunrisers Hyderabad will be looking to reverse the previous defeat and clinch the trophy. 

As the two giants of cricket clash in Chepauk, anticipation and excitement is at its peak. May the best team win!

link.title: SRH vs KKR Final, IPL 2024 - Match Prediction, Playing XI

entry.title: Nepal vs Hurricanes 2nd T20I 2024 - Match Preview, Prediction
entry.content:
The Nepali cricket team is gearing up to play their final practice matches in the United States after completing their training camp in the West Indies.

Following their victorious 3-match series against the Windwards Volcanoes, team Nepal traveled to the United States for a pair of T20 matches against the Houston Hurricanes. The first T20 match is scheduled for May 23, and the second for May 24, with both matches starting at 9:15 pm Nepali time.


Spinner Sandeep Lamichhane, recently reinstated by CAN, may also participate in these matches. With ICC's approval for his inclusion in the World Cup, Sandeep is set to join the team for practice matches and training soon.

After facing the Houston Hurricanes, the Nepali team will play two warm-up matches before the World Cup. They will compete against Canada on May 27 and the host USA on May 30 in Dallas.

link.title: Nepal vs Hurricanes 2nd T20I 2024 - Match Preview, Prediction

entry.title: Real Madrid vs. Real Betis - Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
Real Madrid is set to conclude an almost perfect 2023-24 La Liga season by hosting Real Betis at the Bernabeu on Saturday evening. With the league title already secured, the match holds little significance for both teams. 

Real Madrid remains without David Alaba, who is recovering from an ACL injury, and Aurelien Tchouameni, who is out with a foot injury and will miss the Champions League final.

$ads={2}

Carlo Ancelotti is expected to field his strongest lineup after rotating players in their last match against Villarreal. Thibaut Courtois will return as goalkeeper, and the dynamic attacking trio of Jude Bellingham, Vinicius Junior, and Rodrygo will reclaim their starting positions. 

This setup means fewer opportunities for Guler, Brahim Diaz, and Joselu. Toni Kroos will play his final La Liga match for Real Madrid before retiring later this year.

Real Betis, managed by Pellegrini, will miss several key players due to injuries and suspensions. Aitor Ruibal is absent for unspecified reasons, while Isco is out with a fibula fracture. 

Other notable absentees include Marc Bartra, Cedric Bakambu, Guido Rodriguez, German Pezzella, Chimy Avila, Abner Vinicius, Pablo Fornals, and William Carvalho. 

Ricardo Visus is expected to replace Chadi Riad, who is finalizing a move to Crystal Palace, in the defense alongside Sokratis.


Real Madrid Possible XI:
Courtois; Carvajal, Rudiger, Nacho, Mendy; Valverde, Camavinga, Kroos; Bellingham; Rodrygo, Vinicius Junior

Real Betis possible XI:
Bravo; Sabaly, Sokratis, Visus, Miranda; Roca, Cardoso; Ezzalzouli, Fekir, Perez; Jose

link.title: Real Madrid vs. Real Betis - Match prediction, lineups

entry.title: Pakistan vs England 2nd T20 2024 - Match Prediction, Playing XI
entry.content:
As cricket fans around the world gear up for the upcoming T20 World Cup, England and Pakistan will clash in a much-awaited four-match T20 series. 

This series not only serves as a crucial warm-up for both teams but also rekindles memories of their dramatic encounter in the final of the T20 World Cup 2022 in Melbourne, where England emerged victorious.

Reigning T20 World Cup champions England are eager to assert their dominance in the shortest format of the game. Aiming for their third T20 World Cup title and second consecutive victory, the English team is brimming with confidence.


The team's recent participation in IPL 2024 has ensured that the majority of the players are in top T20 form, having competed against some of the best talent in the world.

On the other hand, Pakistan, led by the prolific Babar Azam, is looking to gain much-needed momentum ahead of the World Cup. The team's recent results in the T20 series have been mixed. 

They played a competitive series against New Zealand at home, which ended in a 2-2 draw, followed by a hard-fought series against Ireland, where they emerged victorious by a 2-1 margin.

link.title: Pakistan vs England 2nd T20 2024 - Match Prediction, Playing XI

entry.title: Sevilla vs. Barcelona - Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
In what could be Xavi's last game as head coach, Barcelona conclude the 2023-24 La Liga season against Sevilla at the Ramon Sanchez Pizjuan Stadium on Sunday night.

Barcelona has already secured second place, while Sevilla will remain in the bottom half. Sevilla will have Boubakri Soumare back from suspension but face fitness problems along with several key players. Jess Navas, Lucas Ocampos and Marcos Acuna missed some training sessions during the week. 

Live Match - Animation Tracker

$ads={2}

Ocampos (illness) and Acua (caution) are expected to play, but Navas and Suso could be out due to muscle fatigue. Additionally, Oliver Torres (shoulder), Isak Romero (hamstring), Djibril Sove (foot), Erik Lamela (knee) and Nemanja Gudelj (knee) are all sidelined.

Navas, who recently signed a life contract but will leave the club at the end of the season, could be replaced by Juanlu Sanchez if he is unfit. Meanwhile, veteran Sergio Ramos remains a key player for Sevilla at the age of 38.

For Barcelona, there is no new fitness update. Alejandro Balde (hamstring), Gavi (ACL) and Frenkie de Jong (ankle) are unavailable. A few lineup changes are possible, with Iaki Pena potentially starting in goal over Marc-Andre ter Stegen, who can no longer catch Athletic's Unai Simeone for the clean sheet title. 


Andreas Christensen could replace Sergi Roberto in defensive midfield, as he did at half-time against Vallecano. Furthermore, Pedri's two goals from the bench in the previous game could give him the starting spot over Fermn Lpez.

Sevilla possible XI lineup:
Nyland; Salas, Bade, Ramos; Sanchez, Soumare, Agoume, Acuna; Lukebakio, En-Nesyri, Ocampos

Barcelona possible XI lineup:
Pena; Kounde, Cubarsi, Martinez, Cancelo; Pedri, Christensen, Gundogan; Yamal, Lewandowski, Raphinha

link.title: Sevilla vs. Barcelona - Match prediction, lineups

entry.title: Real Sociedad vs. Atletico Madrid - Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
Real Sociedad is set to host Atltico Madrid at the Estadio Anoeta this Saturday afternoon in a La Liga match on the final day of the 2023-24 season. Although the game has no impact on the standings, there is still a lot of excitement.

Real Sociedad will be looking to avenge their 2-1 defeat to Atletico in the clash at Civitas Metropolitano in October. However, they would miss several key players due to injuries: Robin Le Normand and Igor Zubelda (muscle injury), and Ahn Muoz and Carlos Fernndez (knee injury). 


Additionally, Martin Zubimendi is struggling with a muscular problem and will be evaluated before the game.Coach Imanol Alguacil may change his lineup slightly, giving players like Alvaro Odriozola, Ander Barrenetxea, Takefusa Kubo and Andre Silva a chance to start after being on the bench last weekend.

 Mikel Oyarzabal, top scorer with 14 goals this season, will be keen to improve his record against Atletico, a team against whom he has scored only once in his last 11 matches.

For Atltico, Vitolo (knee), Nahuel Molina (hamstring), and Pablo Barrios (muscle) are all out with injuries, and Stefan Savic is a doubt with a knock. 


Gabriel Paulista is suspended for accumulating too many yellow cards. However, Axel Witsel and Jose Jimenez are back from their suspensions and could join Mario Hermoso in defence.

There is also speculation that several Atltico players will possibly leave the club this summer. Memphis Depay, Saul Niguez, Angel Correa and Alvaro Morata could all make their final appearances for the team on Saturday.

link.title: Real Sociedad vs. Atletico Madrid - Match prediction, lineups

entry.title: Man City vs. Man United - Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
Under the iconic arch of Wembley Stadium, Manchester City and Manchester United will face off once again in the 143rd FA Cup Final this Saturday. This highly anticipated Manchester derby is a rematch of last year's encounter, with City eager to defend their title and achieve their eighth FA Cup win, while United are eager for revenge and their 13th cup win. 

For City, the notable absence is goalkeeper Ederson, who was sidelined with a broken eye socket against Spurs. Stefan Ortega, who was selected for City's FA Cup cap during their run to the final, will step in.

entry.title: Atalanta BC vs. Bayer Leverkusen - Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
After a remarkable 51-game unbeaten run, Bayer Leverkusen is set to defend their record in the Europa League final against Atalanta BC on Wednesday in Dublin. Leverkusen aims to capture the second leg of a historic treble, while Atalanta pursues their first-ever European trophy. 

Leverkusen's manager, Xabi Alonso, benefits from a fully fit squad, allowing him the luxury of choice. Piero Hincapie and influential midfielder Granit Xhaka are likely to return to the starting lineup. In attack, Alonso has the option to field either Victor Boniface or Patrick Schick, or possibly deploy a 'false nine' formation.

$ads={2}

Florian Wirtz, Leverkusen's standout player, is expected to start after being carefully managed due to a thigh injury. Wirtz has been exceptional this season, with 18 goals and 19 assists in all competitions, including 11 career goals in the Europa League.

Atalanta, meanwhile, will look to the attacking threats of Charles De Ketelaere, Ademola Lookman, and Teun Koopmeiners, with Gianluca Scamacca set to lead the line. Scamacca has been in excellent form, scoring in each knockout round and amassing six Europa League goals this season. 

Despite some injury challenges, including the absence of experienced captain Marten De Roon and a less than fully fit Rafael Toloi, Atalanta welcomes back Emil Holm and Sead Kolasinac. Either Kolasinac or Giorgio Scalvini is expected to join Isak Hien and Berat Djimsiti in defense.


With both teams determined and well-prepared, the final in Dublin promises to be an exciting and closely contested match.

Atalanta BC possible starting lineup:
Musso; Djimsiti, Hien, Scalvini; Zappacosta, Pasalic, Ederson, Ruggeri; Koopmeiners, De Ketelaere; Scamacca

Bayer Leverkusen possible starting lineup:
Kovar; Tapsoba, Tah, Hincapie; Frimpong, Xhaka, Andrich, Grimaldo; Hofmann, Wirtz; Schick

link.title: Atalanta BC vs. Bayer Leverkusen - Match prediction, lineups

entry.title: Newcastle United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - Match prediction, lineups
entry.content:
Just three days after the Premier League season concluded, Newcastle United and Tottenham Hotspur head to Australia for a post-season friendly on Wednesday. They will face each other at the huge Melbourne Cricket Ground, with capacity for 100,000 fans.

These two teams finished close together in the Championship, with Spurs dropping to fifth place and Newcastle just two places behind in seventh.

Live Match - Animation Tracker

$ads={2}

Newcastle manager Eddie Howe has called up 29 players for the friendlies in Australia but is missing some key players. Anthony Gordon is absent with an Achilles injury and Fabian Schar is still recovering from a hamstring strain. 

Other notable absences include Sean Longstaff, Martin Dubravka, Loris Karius and Sandro Tonali, who is serving a 10-month ban for gambling. However, stars Alexander Isak and Bruno Guimares, who scored last weekend, are available. Young talents Garang Kuol and Harrison Ashby were also called up after a loan spell.

On the Tottenham side, Cristian Romero, Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg and Giovani Lo Celso did not travel. Injuries ruled out Richarlison, Destiny Udogie, Yves Bissouma, Timo Werner and Ben Davies. 

But Spurs fans can expect to see captain Son Heung-min, Pedro Porro, Micky van de Ven, Rodrigo Bentancur, James Maddison, Brennan Johnson and Dejan Kulusevski, who scored twice against Sheffield United, in action. Additionally, young midfielders Rio Kyerematen and Leo Black joined the team for the first time. 


Meanwhile, promising youngster Mikey Moore is absent as he represents England at the European Under-17 Championship.

Newcastle United possible starting lineup:
Pope; Trippier, Krafth, Burn, Hall; White, Guimaraes, Anderson; Almiron, Wilson, Barnes

Tottenham Hotspur possible starting lineup:
Austin; Porro, Phillips, Van de Ven, Emerson; Skipp, Sarr; Johnson, Maddison, Kulusevski; Son

link.title: Newcastle United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - Match prediction, lineups

entry.title: RCB vs RR, Eliminator IPL 2024 Match Prediction & Playing XI
entry.content:
Rajasthan Royals (RR) will face Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) this Wednesday in the eliminator match of the IPL 2024 playoffs.

In the IPL, the eliminator is an important match played between the third and fourth placed teams in the points table. The winner of this match will advance to Qualifier 2, where they will face the loser of Qualifier 1 for a chance to play in the final.

RR finished third with 17 points and a net run rate of 0.273, winning eight of their 14 group stage matches, with one lost. On the other hand, RCB, with seven wins and seven losses from 14 matches, finished fourth with 14 points and a net run rate of 0.459.

Historically, RR and RCB have faced each other 31 times in IPL. The Royals have won 13 of these meetings, while the Royal Challengers have finished in the top 15 times. Three matches between these teams were cancelled.

Rajasthan Royals Squad: 
Yashasvi Jaiswal, Tom Kohler-Cadmore, Sanju Samson(w/c), Riyan Parag, Dhruv Jurel, Rovman Powell, Ravichandran Ashwin, Trent Boult, Sandeep Sharma, Avesh Khan, Nandre Burger, Yuzvendra Chahal, Kuldeep Sen, Shubham Dubey, Keshav Maharaj, Donovan Ferreira, Navdeep Saini, Shimron Hetmyer, Tanush Kotian, Abid Mushtaq, Kunal Singh Rathore

Royal Challengers Bengaluru Squad: 
Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis(c), Rajat Patidar, Glenn Maxwell, Cameron Green, Dinesh Karthik(w), Mahipal Lomror, Karn Sharma, Yash Dayal, Lockie Ferguson, Mohammed Siraj, Swapnil Singh, Anuj Rawat, Suyash Prabhudessai, Vijaykumar Vyshak, Himanshu Sharma, Mayank Dagar, Alzarri Joseph, Manoj Bhandage, Akash Deep, Saurav Chauhan, Rajan Kumar, Tom Curran.

entry.title: Australia vs Scotland 35th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Match 35 of the 2024 T20 World Cup features Australia facing off against Scotland on Saturday evening in St Lucia. Heres our preview of the match. Australia, having won all three of their Group B games so far, are in excellent form, while Scotland have secured two victories and one no-result.

The match will take place at the Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium in Gros Islet, starting at 20:30 local time.

$ads={2}
Australia, the current holders of the 50-over Cricket World Cup trophy, are showing strong form in this tournament, suggesting they could potentially hold both titles soon. They won't underestimate Scotland and are expected to deliver another strong performance.

Scotland has been one of the standout teams in the 2024 T20 World Cup, with their record only marred by rain in Bridgetown against England earlier this month. They are likely to play aggressively and wont be intimidated by the formidable Australian side.

There were over 380 runs and 17 wickets in the last T20I at the Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium so we can expect plenty of action in this game. The surface will offer good pace and carry and a par score is likely to be approaching 200.

Scotland Predicted Playing 11
George Munsey, Michael Jones, Brandon McMullen, Richie Berrington (c), Matthew Cross (wk), Michael Leask, Chris Greaves, Mark Watt, Chris Sole, Brad Wheal, Safyaan Sharif

Australia Predicted Playing 11
David Warner, Travis Head, Mitchell Marsh (c), Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Tim David, Matthew Wade (wk), Pat Cummins, Nathan Ellis, Adam Zampa, Josh Hazlewood

link.title: Australia vs Scotland 35th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Pakistan vs Ireland 34th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Pakistan and Ireland saw their T20 World Cup campaigns end after the match between the USA and Ireland was washed out on Friday. The two teams are now set to play for pride when they meet on Sunday in Florida.

Babar Azam and his Pakistan (PAK) team are out of the T20 World Cup after a dismal performance in their first two matches. Their loss to the United States was shocking, but their capitulation against India was particularly memorable. 

$ads={2}

The win over Canada was too little, too late, as Pakistan was already dependent on other results to advance to the Super-8 stage.

Ireland (IRE) had higher expectations coming into the T20 World Cup. However, Paul Stirling and his team have disappointed many cricket fans worldwide with their batting and bowling performances this campaign. The Irish team will fancy their chances, having recently beaten Pakistan in a T20 match at home.

The match will be played at the Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground, Lauderhill, Florida. The surface will be slightly damp as there has been very rain in recent few days. There could be some inconsistent bounce and batters could struggle to score runs. A score of 150-160 should be defendable.

Pakistan Predicted Playing 11
Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Saim Ayub, Babar Azam (c), Fakhar Zaman, Usman Khan, Shadab Khan/Abrar Ahmed, Imad Wasim, Shaheen Afridi, Naseem Shah, Haris Rauf/Abbas Afridi, Mohammad Amir

Ireland Predicted Playing 11
Andrew Balbirnie, Paul Stirling (c), Lorcan Tucker (wk), Harry Tector, Curtis Campher, George Dockrell, Gareth Delany, Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy, Joshua Little, Craig Young

link.title: Pakistan vs Ireland 34th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: Nepal vs Bangladesh 35th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024
entry.content:
Bangladesh is set to face Nepal in the final match of Group D in the T20 World Cup. A win is crucial for Bangladesh to secure their spot in the Super-8 stage as the second-placed team in their group.

So far, Bangladesh (BAN) has performed reasonably well, winning two out of their three matches. Najmul Shanto and his team started with a thrilling two-wicket victory over Sri Lanka but faced a setback with a loss to South Africa. They bounced back with a solid 25-run win against the Netherlands, showcasing their skills with both bat and ball.


Nepal (NEP) came agonizingly close to pulling off one of the biggest surprises of the tournament, narrowly losing to South Africa by just one run. Despite this heart-breaking exit, Nepal played exceptional cricket and demonstrated why they are considered one of the top associate nations.

We saw spin bowlers enjoying bowling at the Arnos Vale Ground on Friday evening and we expect the slow bowlers to be on top again in this match. A par score is likely to be no higher than 125.

Bangladesh Predicted Playing 11
Tanzid Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto (c), Litton Das (wk), Shakib Al Hasan, Towhid Hridoy, Mahmudullah, Jaker Ali, Rishad Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Tanzim Hasan Sakib, Mustafizur Rahman

Nepal Predicted Playing 11
Kushel Bhurtel, Aasif Sheikh (wk), Rohit Paudel (c), Anil Sah, Dipenra Singh Airee, Kushal Malla, Gulsan Jha, Sompal Kami, Karan KC, Sandeep Lamichhane, Abinash Bohara.

link.title: Nepal vs Bangladesh 35th Match ICC T20 World Cup 2024

entry.title: backup
entry.content:
South Africa, having already secured a spot in the Super 8s of the 2024 ICC T20 World Cup, is aiming for a perfect record as they face off against the struggling Nepal on Saturday, June 15, at the Arnos Vale Stadium in Kingstown, Saint Vincent.

This will be the first-ever international clash between the Proteas and the Rhinos, set to be match number 31 of the T20 World Cup 2024.

$ads={2}

Under the leadership of Adrian Markram, South Africa has amassed 6 points from their three consecutive wins. Despite some close calls, they triumphed over Sri Lanka by 6 wickets, the Netherlands by 4 wickets, and Bangladesh by 4 runs, earning them a place in the tournaments main stage.

In contrast, Nepal is still searching for their first victory in this tournament. With their second match against Sri Lanka ending in a washout, the team, led by Rohit Paudel, has only 1 point and sits in the second-to-last position in Group D. To advance to the Super 8, the Rhinos will need to win their remaining matches against South Africa and Bangladesh.


South Africa Squad:
Quinton de Kock (wk), Aiden Markram (c), Reeza Hendricks, Tristan Stubbs, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Ottneil Baartman, Gerald Coetzee, Ryan Rickelton, Bjorn Fortuin, Tabraiz Shamsi

entry.title: Privacy Policy
entry.content:
Last updated: June 07, 2024

This Privacy Policy describes Our policies and procedures on the collection, use and disclosure of Your information when You use the Service and tells You about Your privacy rights and how the law protects You.

We use Your Personal data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, You agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy has been created with the help of the Privacy Policy Generator.

Interpretation and Definitions

Interpretation

The words of which the initial letter is capitalized have meanings defined under the following conditions. The following definitions shall have the same meaning regardless of whether they appear in singular or in plural.

Definitions

For the purposes of this Privacy Policy:

  • Account means a unique account created for You to access our Service or parts of our Service.

  • Affiliate means an entity that controls, is controlled by or is under common control with a party, where "control" means ownership of 50% or more of the shares, equity interest or other securities entitled to vote for election of directors or other managing authority.

  • Company (referred to as either "the Company", "We", "Us" or "Our" in this Agreement) refers to HLS Plays.

  • Cookies are small files that are placed on Your computer, mobile device or any other device by a website, containing the details of Your browsing history on that website among its many uses.

  • Country refers to: Nepal

  • Device means any device that can access the Service such as a computer, a cellphone or a digital tablet.

  • Personal Data is any information that relates to an identified or identifiable individual.

  • Service refers to the Website.

  • Service Provider means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Company. It refers to third-party companies or individuals employed by the Company to facilitate the Service, to provide the Service on behalf of the Company, to perform services related to the Service or to assist the Company in analyzing how the Service is used.

  • Usage Data refers to data collected automatically, either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).

  • Website refers to HLS Plays, accessible from hls-player.net

  • You means the individual accessing or using the Service, or the company, or other legal entity on behalf of which such individual is accessing or using the Service, as applicable.

Collecting and Using Your Personal Data

Types of Data Collected

Personal Data

While using Our Service, We may ask You to provide Us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify You. Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to:

  • Email address

  • Usage Data

Usage Data

Usage Data is collected automatically when using the Service.

Usage Data may include information such as Your Device's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that You visit, the time and date of Your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.

When You access the Service by or through a mobile device, We may collect certain information automatically, including, but not limited to, the type of mobile device You use, Your mobile device unique ID, the IP address of Your mobile device, Your mobile operating system, the type of mobile Internet browser You use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.

We may also collect information that Your browser sends whenever You visit our Service or when You access the Service by or through a mobile device.

Tracking Technologies and Cookies

We use Cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on Our Service and store certain information. Tracking technologies used are beacons, tags, and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze Our Service. The technologies We use may include:

  • Cookies or Browser Cookies. A cookie is a small file placed on Your Device. You can instruct Your browser to refuse all Cookies or to indicate when a Cookie is being sent. However, if You do not accept Cookies, You may not be able to use some parts of our Service. Unless you have adjusted Your browser setting so that it will refuse Cookies, our Service may use Cookies.
  • Web Beacons. Certain sections of our Service and our emails may contain small electronic files known as web beacons (also referred to as clear gifs, pixel tags, and single-pixel gifs) that permit the Company, for example, to count users who have visited those pages or opened an email and for other related website statistics (for example, recording the popularity of a certain section and verifying system and server integrity).

Cookies can be "Persistent" or "Session" Cookies. Persistent Cookies remain on Your personal computer or mobile device when You go offline, while Session Cookies are deleted as soon as You close Your web browser. You can learn more about cookies on TermsFeed website article.

We use both Session and Persistent Cookies for the purposes set out below:

  • Necessary / Essential Cookies

    Type: Session Cookies

    Administered by: Us

    Purpose: These Cookies are essential to provide You with services available through the Website and to enable You to use some of its features. They help to authenticate users and prevent fraudulent use of user accounts. Without these Cookies, the services that You have asked for cannot be provided, and We only use these Cookies to provide You with those services.

  • Cookies Policy / Notice Acceptance Cookies

    Type: Persistent Cookies

    Administered by: Us

    Purpose: These Cookies identify if users have accepted the use of cookies on the Website.

  • Functionality Cookies

    Type: Persistent Cookies

    Administered by: Us

    Purpose: These Cookies allow us to remember choices You make when You use the Website, such as remembering your login details or language preference. The purpose of these Cookies is to provide You with a more personal experience and to avoid You having to re-enter your preferences every time You use the Website.

For more information about the cookies we use and your choices regarding cookies, please visit our Cookies Policy or the Cookies section of our Privacy Policy.

Use of Your Personal Data

The Company may use Personal Data for the following purposes:

  • To provide and maintain our Service, including to monitor the usage of our Service.

  • To manage Your Account: to manage Your registration as a user of the Service. The Personal Data You provide can give You access to different functionalities of the Service that are available to You as a registered user.

  • For the performance of a contract: the development, compliance and undertaking of the purchase contract for the products, items or services You have purchased or of any other contract with Us through the Service.

  • To contact You: To contact You by email, telephone calls, SMS, or other equivalent forms of electronic communication, such as a mobile application's push notifications regarding updates or informative communications related to the functionalities, products or contracted services, including the security updates, when necessary or reasonable for their implementation.

  • To provide You with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless You have opted not to receive such information.

  • To manage Your requests: To attend and manage Your requests to Us.

  • For business transfers: We may use Your information to evaluate or conduct a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or other sale or transfer of some or all of Our assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which Personal Data held by Us about our Service users is among the assets transferred.

  • For other purposes: We may use Your information for other purposes, such as data analysis, identifying usage trends, determining the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns and to evaluate and improve our Service, products, services, marketing and your experience.

We may share Your personal information in the following situations:

  • With Service Providers: We may share Your personal information with Service Providers to monitor and analyze the use of our Service, to contact You.
  • For business transfers: We may share or transfer Your personal information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of Company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of Our business to another company.
  • With Affiliates: We may share Your information with Our affiliates, in which case we will require those affiliates to honor this Privacy Policy. Affiliates include Our parent company and any other subsidiaries, joint venture partners or other companies that We control or that are under common control with Us.
  • With business partners: We may share Your information with Our business partners to offer You certain products, services or promotions.
  • With other users: when You share personal information or otherwise interact in the public areas with other users, such information may be viewed by all users and may be publicly distributed outside.
  • With Your consent: We may disclose Your personal information for any other purpose with Your consent.

Retention of Your Personal Data

The Company will retain Your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use Your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies.

The Company will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period of time, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to improve the functionality of Our Service, or We are legally obligated to retain this data for longer time periods.

Transfer of Your Personal Data

Your information, including Personal Data, is processed at the Company's operating offices and in any other places where the parties involved in the processing are located. It means that this information may be transferred to and maintained on computers located outside of Your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ than those from Your jurisdiction.

Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by Your submission of such information represents Your agreement to that transfer.

The Company will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that Your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of Your Personal Data will take place to an organization or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of Your data and other personal information.

Delete Your Personal Data

You have the right to delete or request that We assist in deleting the Personal Data that We have collected about You.

Our Service may give You the ability to delete certain information about You from within the Service.

You may update, amend, or delete Your information at any time by signing in to Your Account, if you have one, and visiting the account settings section that allows you to manage Your personal information. You may also contact Us to request access to, correct, or delete any personal information that You have provided to Us.

Please note, however, that We may need to retain certain information when we have a legal obligation or lawful basis to do so.

Disclosure of Your Personal Data

Business Transactions

If the Company is involved in a merger, acquisition or asset sale, Your Personal Data may be transferred. We will provide notice before Your Personal Data is transferred and becomes subject to a different Privacy Policy.

Law enforcement

Under certain circumstances, the Company may be required to disclose Your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities (e.g. a court or a government agency).

Other legal requirements

The Company may disclose Your Personal Data in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to:

  • Comply with a legal obligation
  • Protect and defend the rights or property of the Company
  • Prevent or investigate possible wrongdoing in connection with the Service
  • Protect the personal safety of Users of the Service or the public
  • Protect against legal liability

Security of Your Personal Data

The security of Your Personal Data is important to Us, but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While We strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect Your Personal Data, We cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Children's Privacy

Our Service does not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13. If You are a parent or guardian and You are aware that Your child has provided Us with Personal Data, please contact Us. If We become aware that We have collected Personal Data from anyone under the age of 13 without verification of parental consent, We take steps to remove that information from Our servers.

If We need to rely on consent as a legal basis for processing Your information and Your country requires consent from a parent, We may require Your parent's consent before We collect and use that information.

Links to Other Websites

Our Service may contain links to other websites that are not operated by Us. If You click on a third party link, You will be directed to that third party's site. We strongly advise You to review the Privacy Policy of every site You visit.

We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

We may update Our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify You of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

We will let You know via email and/or a prominent notice on Our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update the "Last updated" date at the top of this Privacy Policy.

You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, You can contact us:

  • By email: mail@hls-player.net
